Title: Software Engineer - Börsdata
Description:
Är du redo för en ny spännande möjlighet och vill vara med och bidra i Avanzas strävan att föra investeringsvärlden in i framtiden?




Vi letar efter en passionerad Backend-utvecklare som gillar att växa med uppgiften och ser design och skalning av mjukvara som en naturlig del av sitt jobb. Ditt bidrag kommer att vara avgörande för att säkerställa att våra kunder fortsätter att njuta av en enkel, trygg och lustfylld investeringsupplevelse, samtidigt som du arbetar i ett härligt team som brinner för att göra skillnad. Ta chansen att utvecklas hos oss och skapa en ljus framtid för våra kunder!




Om rollen och teamet

Som medlem i Team Börsdata, kommer du att spela en central roll i att underhålla och utveckla nya tjänster och integrationer inom Avanzas börshandel, med fokus på att tillhandahålla marknadsdata. Teamet värdesätter stark stabilitet, prestanda och säkerhet.




Teamet består av fyra utvecklare, en produktägare och en engineering manager och behöver nu växa. De äger sin egen backlog och roadmap och har fullt ansvar för vad som ska prioriteras utifrån både affär och teknik. Teamet arbetar i korta iterationer och roterar både SM och supportansvar.




Teamets bidrag till vår affär är helt avgörande då stora delar av Avanzas utvecklingsteam är beroende av den börsdata teamet tillhandahåller. Med många interna och externa intressenter så är det viktigt för teamet att bibehålla ett kundfokuserat tillvägagångssätt med positiv approach oavsett högt tryck i perioder.




Din profil

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att arbeta med microservices och distribuerade system i Java. Du ser det som självklart att skriva välstrukturerad, testbar och skalbar kod. Har du tidigare arbetat med handelsrelaterade system inom fintech är det en bonus.




Ditt intresse av att lära dig och vara en del av ett team som bygger robusta, skalbara och lättskötta system kommer att vara ovärderligt när de omformas för molnet (GCP). Låg latens och hög throughput är avgörande.




Tekniker och verktyg vi använder:

Java 21
Spring, Spring Boot
MongoDB
Eventdriven arkitektur (Kafka och Event Sourcing)
REST och GRPC
Minnesdata-plattformen Gigaspaces
Tools: Splunk, Grafana, Jenkins, GIT, Jira, Kanban




För att lyckas i den här rollen är du inte bara tekniskt skicklig utan vi tror även att du matchar in på de personliga egenskaper vi söker:




Samarbete är nyckeln till vår framgång och vi letar därför efter någon som stöttar sina kollegor och som skapar en positiv och givande arbetsmiljö runt sig.
Effektivitet är avgörande för vårt arbete, och vi behöver en kollega som tar initiativ, sätter ambitiösa mål och arbetar målmedvetet för att uppnå dem. Rollen är bred och i perioder är det nödvändigt att du effektivt hanterar att prioritera de viktigaste arbetsuppgifterna.
Vi uppskattar snabbtänkthet och nyfikenhet, och letar efter en person som aktivt söker nya kunskaper och metoder, tar sig an komplexa uppgifter med tillförsikt och tror på sin förmåga att snabbt anpassa sig till förändringar och lära sig nya färdigheter.




Ansökan:

Skicka gärna din ansökan snarast då urvalet sker löpande, dock senast den 18 maj. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl p.g.a. GDPR.




Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.




Välkommen med din ansökan!

Show more

  • REST och GRPC
  • Minnesdata-plattformen Gigaspaces
  • Tools: Splunk, Grafana, Jenkins, GIT, Jira, Kanban


För att lyckas i den här rollen är du inte bara tekniskt skicklig utan vi tror även att du matchar in på de personliga egenskaper vi söker:


  • Samarbete är nyckeln till vår framgång och vi letar därför efter någon som stöttar sina kollegor och som skapar en positiv och givande arbetsmiljö runt sig.
  • Effektivitet är avgörande för vårt arbete, och vi behöver en kollega som tar initiativ, sätter ambitiösa mål och arbetar målmedvetet för att uppnå dem. Rollen är bred och i perioder är det nödvändigt att du effektivt hanterar att prioritera de viktigaste arbetsuppgifterna.
  • Vi uppskattar snabbtänkthet och nyfikenhet, och letar efter en person som aktivt söker nya kunskaper och metoder, tar sig an komplexa uppgifter med tillförsikt och tror på sin förmåga att snabbt anpassa sig till förändringar och lära sig nya färdigheter.


Ansökan:

Skicka gärna din ansökan snarast då urvalet sker löpande, dock senast den 18 maj. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl p.g.a. GDPR.


Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.


Välkommen med din ansökan!

Title: IT Systems Engineer
Description:
About Planet

Planet is a global provider of integrated technology and payments solutions for retail and hospitality customers.

We create great experiences for the millions of people who use our payments, software, and tax-free solutions every minute of every day.

Planet empowers its customers to deliver great customer experiences by combining payments and software in ways that drive greater loyalty, increase revenue and save time.

Founded over 35 years ago and with our headquarters in London, today we have more than 2,500 employees located across six continents serving our customers in more than 120 markets.

Role Overview

As an IT Systems Engineer, you are responsible for our Data Center in Stockholm and for the maintenance, administration and installation of our server systems and our network. Do you already have experience in the areas mentioned and would you like to learn about new areas? You are willing to be part of oncall responsibility out of busines hours ? Then you've come to the right place!

We work with agile development methods and use Atlassian Jira and Confluene.

What You Will Do


Maintenance, administration & installation of server systems (Windows, Linux)
Administration of the network infrastructure
Administration of our VMware Virtualization environment
Administration of the Data Recovery Tool veeam
IT hardware preparation and provisioning
Software distribution and software standardization
Monitoring the IT landscape
Creation, review and updating of IT documentation and the IT emergency concept
Participation in IT projects and continuous improvement of the IT landscape
ITSM-based way of working with Jira


Who You Are


Completed training as an IT systems integration specialist, a degree in computer science or a comparable professional qualification
Professional experience as an IT Systems Engineer
Good knowledge of written and spoken English
Ability to work under pressure and a high level of motivation
Willingness to participate on our rolling oncall duty out of business hours
A structured, independent and goal-oriented way of working
A sense of responsibility for yourself, your actions and your professional progress
Analytical skills and strong problem-solving skills
Willingness to acquire new knowledge and participate in training and certifications
The position requires on-call availability on a rotational basis, one week per month.


Why Planet

Planet is an equal opportunity employer where diversity is valued, and all employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.

Come and grow your career in the most exciting, fast paced technology market, with a business that delivers feel-good connected commerce.

At Planet, we embrace a hybrid work model, with three days a week in the office.

Reasonable accommodations may be made in order to allow for an individual to perform the essential functions of this role successfully.
Show more

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Senior Java Developer – MedTech – Stockholm – Hybrid

An established and fast-growing company in the medical technology space is looking for a Senior Java Developer to join their product development team in Stockholm. You'll be working on impactful software used across healthcare systems to streamline operations and improve patient care.




What you’ll do:

Build and maintain systems that support various healthcare workflows — from integrations with national systems to enhancing internal platforms.
Work across architecture, design, and development tasks.
Engage with clients to understand their needs and translate them into practical, patient-focused solutions.




What you bring:

Strong experience with Java and solid understanding of object-oriented programming (C# or similar).
Confidence in writing clean, testable, and scalable code.
Familiarity with relational databases and SQL.
Fluent English and full work rights in Sweden.




Bonus if you have:

Experience in the healthcare or MedTech sector.
Skills in 4D, JavaScript, or Node.js.
Degree in Software Development or similar.




What’s in it for you:

Hybrid work model (2–3 days onsite in Stockholm)
Work with a modern stack on meaningful projects
Friendly and collaborative culture




Looking for your next role in a purpose-driven tech environment? Let’s talk.

Looking for your next role in a purpose-driven tech environment? Let’s talk.

Title: Backend Developer
Description:
We’re looking for a skilled Backend Developer to help build engaging, educational, and social investing experiences for banks and brokers. You’ll play a key role in designing, developing, and optimizing the backend systems that power our platform, ensuring high performance, scalability, and security.




As part of our talented tech team, you’ll collaborate closely with the tech and design teams to create seamless, data-driven experiences for investors.




The role

To be successful in this role, we think that you:

Have at least a few years of experience with Python.
Enjoy writing SQL, but also know your way around an ORM.
Have some experience with a Python web framework (Django, Flask, FastAPI, etc.).
Feel comfortable with our current tech stack: Python, Postgres, Redis, and Linux.
Can work independently and would enjoy taking ownership of one or more subsystems.




As a person, you are:

Communicative.
Self-propelled.
Willing to learn and curious about new tech.
Humble.




Our offer
Market salary and a pension plan to secure your future.
30 days of vacation, plus 12 public holidays (with half-days before each) to truly recharge.
Wellness stipend to support your physical and mental well-being.
Flexibility to work remotely or in the office—choose the setup that works best for you.
Regular team offsites to connect, collaborate, and have fun.
Your choice of company computer, so you have the tools you need to do your best work.
Big responsibilities and lots of freedom in a small but fast-growing company—your impact will be tangible, and your voice will be heard.




Location

We are working in a flexible hybrid setup. But as the office and most of our colleagues are located in Stockholm, we are seeking candidates who are based in the Stockholm area to join our team and come into the office a few days a week.




About us

StockRepublic, established in 2019 with offices in both Stockholm and Hamburg, is a B2B fintech company that helps banks activate, engage, and grow their users. With our products (available via white label and API), bank and brokerage clients can keep a competitive edge by offering an interactive, educational investing experience so that average investors can beat the market.




We've successfully established strong communities for leading banks across the world, including renowned names such as Commerzbank, interactive investor, and Avanza.




We invite you to join us on this mission as we strive to outperform the market together.

Title: Founding Software Engineer (full-stack)
Description:
Company Description

Accessing high-quality data (deep domain, fact-checked, multimodal) is a major bottle-neck for AI-firms to achieve its full potential. RedpineAI unlocks proprietary data for AI through its intelligent platform model. To enable this goal, we're breaking new ground in data discovery, delivery and evaluation - in a way that is fair to all stakeholders.




RedpineAI is an early-stage company on a massive mission. We now assemble the right core team for the job. Our ambition is limitless and are on a good trajectory, with recent funding to fuel this growth.




Role Description

We are looking for a full-time role for a Founding Software Engineer (full-stack, with more gravitation to front), located in Stockholm. The role involves developing and maintaining both front-end and back-end components of web applications, designing robust and scalable software architecture, coding, testing, and debugging software.




The role will collaborate with colleagues in Data Science and AI/ML, and GTM to build the best possible solutions and products and report to our CPTO.




Qualifications

Strong foundations in Computer Science and an eye for world-class UX-driven design
Understanding in Back-End Web Development and Software Engineering (SWE)
Expertise in Programming languages and development frameworks
Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills (English)
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field; advanced degrees are a plus
Experience and interest in AI enablements/productivity, agentic workflows




Cultural fit

Team player spirit, curiosity for new areas, the ability to gain new skills, and a love for data/AI helps
We mainly work on-site for quick communication flow, but some remote work can work to some degree
We are looking for commitment, ownership and agency, hence prefer full-time employment over consulting-assignments for this role




Compensation

Fixed salary and equity upside

Title: Platform Engineer
Description:
Why Lovable?


Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (According to industry veterans)
Work, learn, have fun: We're building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
Build a unique network: Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
Get autonomy & ownership: With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
Compensation: Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis


What We're Looking For


You're obsessed with building systems that scale beautifully and have built infra that handles massive, unpredictable load
Deep experience with Rust, Terraform, and Kubernetes (or alternatives like Nomad) for infrastructure engineering
You geek out about container isolation and microVM management (e.g., Firecracker)
You have strong opinions about security and aren't afraid to enforce them


Your Responsibilities


Design, manage, and optimize our microVM sandbox infrastructure built with Rust, Firecracker, and other state-of-the-art technologies
Create infrastructure so reliable, devs forget it exists (and that can scale from 0 to infinity)
Make our microVMs boot faster than you can blink
Build security so tight that even paranoid developers trust it
Create self-healing infrastructure that fixes problems before they happen
Make infrastructure decisions that won't come back to haunt us


Our tech stack

We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:


Frontend: React for lightning-fast interfaces
Backend: Golang and Rust for serious performance
Cloud: Cloudflare, Fly.io, Google Cloud Run, AWS, Terraform
And always exploring what's next


How Applying Works


Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
We'll send you a quick take-home for (1) a written case study and (2) a loom video presentation
Join us for a round of interviews
If possible, join us for a week of (paid) trial work. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team & explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you


Apply by clicking the link below.

https://antonosika.typeform.com/to/nHtqKmJD?role=Platform+Engineer&typeform-source=lovable.dev

Title: Fullstack Developer - My AI Platform
Description:
Are you a skilled and passionate Fullstack Developer looking to take the technical lead of an exciting community platform and drive its future development? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment and have a knack for translating user needs into elegant technical solutions? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

About the Role:

Join AI Sweden's core team as a Fullstack Developer for our My AI platform. You'll drive the technical evolution, from maintaining and enhancing existing features to developing exciting new ones. Collaborate closely with the Product Owner and UX/Product Designer to translate user needs into impactful technical solutions.

Key Responsibilities:


Lead the full technical lifecycle: development, maintenance, and issue resolution for the My AI platform.
Spearhead the creation of new features and the enhancement of existing functionalities.
Collaborate with the Product Owner and UX/Product Designer to define and implement user-centric solutions.
Ensure platform scalability, performance, and security (including encrypted communication and two-factor authentication).
Manage user access controls and implement internationalization.
Proactively identify and implement improvements and optimizations.


Technical Skills and Experience (Required):

The ideal candidate will possess strong experience and knowledge in the following technologies and architecture:


Strong proficiency in PHP and the Laravel framework with Inertia.
Advanced expertise in Vue.js for building dynamic UIs.
Solid experience with GitHub for version control.
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), specifically EC2 and RDS (MySQL).
Experience with WebSockets for real-time communication.
Proficiency in TailwindCSS for web application design.


Additional Skills and Experience (Valuable):


Experience with social/community platforms and scaling for large user bases.
Familiarity with agile development.
Understanding of UX and Design principles.
Experience with deployment tools like Forge and CI/CD pipelines.


What We Offer:


A key role in developing an innovative community platform at AI Sweden.
A collaborative and dynamic work environment.
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and contribute to meaningful work.
Significant impact on the platform's direction and growth.
Stimulating environment for professional development.


Location: Gothenburg, Stockholm

Are you ready to take on this exciting challenge? Apply now and become a vital part of the My AI team at AI Sweden!

Application process

The application deadline is May 9th, but applications will be processed on a running basis. This is a project-based position with a strong possibility of extension.

Please submit your CV and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are a great fit for this role. We look forward to hearing from you!

If you have any questions about this role please don't hesitate to contact the product owner Irina Glass Balog.

AI Sweden does not accept unsolicited support and kindly ask not to be contacted by any advertisement agents, recruitment agencies or manning companies.

Title: Senior Full Stack Developer
Description:
Urval sker löpande
Arbete på plats



Arbetsuppgifter

Vill du vara med och utveckla hur företag arbetar med försäljning med hjälp av den senaste tekniken, artificiell intelligens och användarvänlig design? Upsales revolutionerar CRM-branschen genom sin digitala plattform för B2B-säljare och företag. Med hjälp av AI-teknik automatiserar vi processer, analyserar data och skapar insikter som hjälper våra kunder att fatta smartare beslut. Börsnoterade Upsales växer så det knakar och med fokus på tech behöver vi skala vårt team ännu mer. Vi söker dig som vill vara en viktig del av en tillväxtresa och verkligen kunna påverka – på Upsales är du inte ett litet kugghjul i ett stort maskineri.

Om tjänstenHos Upsales får du arbeta med de senaste teknologierna, inklusive AI, och ta stort eget ansvar. Du blir en del av ett tight gäng bestående av cirka 20 utvecklare. På Upsales jobbar vi tätt tillsammans men med stor frihet. Vårt mål är att utveckla en grym produkt med AI som en viktig komponent för att förbättra användarupplevelsen och optimera försäljningsprocesserna. Det finns inget klart recept på hur vi ska gå tillväga, istället jobbar vi fram lösningar både tillsammans och individuellt med fokus på kunderna och effektivitet i leveranser.

Du erbjuds


Möjligheten att bygga en produkt med de senaste teknikerna, så som: React, Node.js, TypeScript, Figma.
Bli en del av ett litet team , med korta beslutsvägar och stort utrymme att påverka.
Vara med på Upsales tillväxtresa, där du får utvecklas med seniora kollegor.
Remote Working – Upsales sitter på Kungsgatan 49 i Stockholm – Efter provanställning finns möjlighet att arbeta remote två dagar i veckan



Vi söker dig som har:


Högskole- eller civilingenjörsexamen inom relevant område
Erfarenhet av att arbeta som Full Stack developer i minst 5 år
Arbetat med React och Node.js i minst 3 år
Utmärkta kunskaper i svenska och engelskaFör att trivas i rollen tror vi att du är:
Driven och trivs i en start-up-miljö med högt tempo och mycket samarbete
Analytisk med en god förmåga att se helheten och förstå affären
Självgående och gillar att ta egna initiativ
Kanske viktigast av allt, du är en hacker som är grym på programmering och älskar att hitta nya lösningar på problem!



Övrigt/ansökanTjänsten är på heltid, tillsvidare och med placering på vårt kontor i Stockholm. Tillsättning sker så snart som möjligt.
Show more

Med hjälp av AI-teknik automatiserar vi processer, analyserar data och skapar insikter som hjälper våra kunder att fatta smartare beslut. Börsnoterade Upsales växer så det knakar och med fokus på tech behöver vi skala vårt team ännu mer. Vi söker dig som vill vara en viktig del av en tillväxtresa och verkligen kunna påverka – på Upsales är du inte ett litet kugghjul i ett stort maskineri.

Om tjänstenHos Upsales får du arbeta med de senaste teknologierna, inklusive AI, och ta stort eget ansvar. Du blir en del av ett tight gäng bestående av cirka 20 utvecklare. På Upsales jobbar vi tätt tillsammans men med stor frihet. Vårt mål är att utveckla en grym produkt med AI som en viktig komponent för att förbättra användarupplevelsen och optimera försäljningsprocesserna. Det finns inget klart recept på hur vi ska gå tillväga, istället jobbar vi fram lösningar både tillsammans och individuellt med fokus på kunderna och effektivitet i leveranser.

Du erbjuds

  • Möjligheten att bygga en produkt med de senaste teknikerna, så som: React, Node.js, TypeScript, Figma.
  • Bli en del av ett litet team , med korta beslutsvägar och stort utrymme att påverka.
  • Vara med på Upsales tillväxtresa, där du får utvecklas med seniora kollegor.
  • Remote Working – Upsales sitter på Kungsgatan 49 i Stockholm – Efter provanställning finns möjlighet att arbeta remote två dagar i veckan


Vi söker dig som har:

  • Högskole- eller civilingenjörsexamen inom relevant område
  • Erfarenhet av att arbeta som Full Stack developer i minst 5 år
  • Arbetat med React och Node.js i minst 3 år
  • Utmärkta kunskaper i svenska och engelskaFör att trivas i rollen tror vi att du är:
  • Driven och trivs i en start-up-miljö med högt tempo och mycket samarbete
  • Analytisk med en god förmåga att se helheten och förstå affären
  • Självgående och gillar att ta egna initiativ
  • Kanske viktigast av allt, du är en hacker som är grym på programmering och älskar att hitta nya lösningar på problem!


Övrigt/ansökanTjänsten är på heltid, tillsvidare och med placering på vårt kontor i Stockholm. Tillsättning sker så snart som möjligt.

Title: ESS Solutions Engineer - Sweden
Description:
Your mission

This is a first-class opportunity to join Sungrow Power EMEA as a principal engineer, specialising in Battery Energy Storage System to join our ESS technical Team based in Sweden. As a principal engineer you will focus on technical design and ESS customized solution proposal to support the delivery of the energy storage (mainly battery energy storage system--BESS) assignment and take a leading position in supporting Sungrow ESS European market and development. You will also support the solar PV, wind and other renewable energy projects for the group.

In General, Your Responsibilities Will Be


Managing and performing high quality technical advisory works for the pre-sale’s activities
Project manager and interfacing between engineering disciplines (ESS electric, mechanical, civil and control scheme)
Provide technical input from initial assessment through to technical and economic feasibility of the project and integration with other electrical or generating plants as necessary
Review overall project conceptual design, detailed design, and design and suggest technical and design improvement for ESS projects
Preparation and management of specifications, tendering, negotiation, and selection of battery storage system plant
Due diligence of ESS projects and support customer and lender throughout the financial close process including technical liaison with legal and financial advisors
Knowledge of renewable generation utility network connection quality studies and PCS dynamic performance approval process would be an advantage strength
ESS technical specifications establishment as per European countries regulation and international standards (IEC/IEEE)


Your profile

All Good, That Sounded Great Right? Now Let`s Have a Look At Your Background, So You Get a Feeling If This Could Be The Right Challenge For You


Bachelor’s degree (Engineering) or equivalent (electrical preferred)
Experience on BESS technology, Mix of UK and overseas (European) experience would be ideal.
An in-depth knowledge and field expertise regarding to BESS technologies including the emerging technologies and the international market
Technical advisory experience towards investors, project developers and experience with BESS plant design dealing with technical advisory support
International solar PV or Hybrid projects development and delivery experience
Proven experience in technical review communication with client and other project parties (utilities, BoP, EPC, etc)
Language: English and Swedish at least C1, other languages are always great to have!


Why us?

This decade might be overshadowed by Covid19, but sooner or later we will beat and overcome that son of a germ, am I right?

But the true topic for this decade lies in energy！

We Are More Than Happy To State That Not Only We Are Leading This Discourse, We Also Offer The Fitting Solutions For It. We Have The Strongest PV-Inverter R&D There Is And Became The World`s Biggest Inverter Manufacturer, Which We Are Extremely Proud Of!And Now, For This Decade, We Are Increasing Our Game, And You, You Might Become Part Of It! Besides That, Many Things Await You


Opportunities for Career advancement
Bonus payment based on pre-agreed and signed KPI agreements
A multinational team awaits You with lots of european and transeuropean exchange!
Possibility for technical and commercial knowledge increasement in regard to string inverters, central inverters, inverter stations including transformer and switch gear and storage solutions
Technical and commercial training in our headquarter in Germany and even visits to the big R&D facility in China!


About Us

We are a green tech company with young creative minds.

We are fighting every day to make our mission happen – Clean Power for All!

With 650+GW of clean power presently installed worldwide, we are on the road to success!

Welcome at Sungrow

Founded in 1997 by University Professor Cao Renxian, Sungrow is a leader in the research and development of solar inverters with the largest dedicated R&D team in the industry and a broad product portfolio offering PV inverter solutions and energy storage systems for utility-scale, commercial & industrial, and residential applications, as well as internationally recognized floating PV plant solutions, NEV driving solutions, EV charging solutions and renewable hydrogen production systems.

Want to know more? Check out what working with us is like!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Scientist




What’s more meaningful than seeing the real-world impact of your work?




Ok, maybe ending world hunger, but this is a strong second. 




At OOONO, you’re not just building models in a notebook. You’re shaping the algorithms that directly power a physical product - used in real time by real people in the real world.

Join a small, collaborative team where you’re trusted to take ownership, test bold ideas, and push things into production. You’ll work hands-on with rich geospatial data to make our location logic smarter and faster.




And you’ll do it side by side with engineers, hardware specialists, and designers who genuinely care - about the product, the users, and each other.




What you’ll be doing

Develop and improve core algorithms to enhance product performance and user experience.
Contribute to map matching logic and road network analysis to improve location accuracy
Design, build, and maintain predictive models to solve complex business challenges.
Analyze large-scale data sets from Athena, MongoDB, and other sources to extract actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Software, Hardware, UX/UI) to implement data-driven solutions.
Experiment with cutting-edge geospatial tools and frameworks to continuously improve analytical workflows.
Handle location data and geo spatial field.




We imagine you’re someone who has

A master’s degree in data science, geoinformatics or similar field
Proven experience (3+ years) in a Data Science role or similar, ideally within a tech environment and working with geospatial data
Proficiency in Python, including libraries such as Polars, NumPy, Scikit-Learn, and geospatial libraries like GeoPandas, Shapely, Pyproj, Folium, Osmnx
Knowledge of geospatial analysis techniques (e.g., spatial joins, indexing, projections).
Strong understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning, and algorithm development.
Solid problem-solving skills and ability to work independently when needed 
Hands-on person that can drive processes from A to B independently
English is a requirement.
Self-driven 




How is it working at OOONO?

We’re glad we asked. It’s a nice working place. As in nice-nice. We have a relaxed, informal atmosphere and a flat hierarchy. Whenever you need a break from your important work stuff, you can get beat in table tennis, foosball, or just smalltalk about the weather by the coffee machine. We have monthly social events where we do anything from go-karting to going to festivals. 




And when we’re not social? Then we’re pretty damn ambitious. We don’t like conservative targets or linear growth. We’re all about the extraordinary. This has led OOONO to become one of the fastest-growing tech scaleups and surprise-surprise: We have no plans of slowing down. So yes, OOONO is a lovely place to work, but it’s also a pretty good opportunity to develop as a person and take the next steps in your career. 




The practical stuff

Start date: ASAP
Send your motivated CV to job@ooono.dk
Working hours: Full-time (37 hours)
Location: Gearhalsvej 1.1, 2500 Valby
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data and analytics, and eager to drive business value through actionable insights? Do you thrive in dynamic environments and love turning complex data into clear, impactful solutions?




We’re looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to join the team in Copenhagen for a 12 month period. You will play a pivotal role in our Customer Insights initiatives, helping us understand customer behaviors and enhance decision-making across the organization.




Would you like to…




Lead and steer data tracks of projects, conducting exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover trends and insights within large datasets
Develop and maintain AI-driven codebases, including predictive models, classification algorithms, and clustering techniques
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to seamlessly integrate AI and data science solutions into business operations
Provide BI expertise by creating and maintaining dashboards using tools like PowerBI
Translate complex data findings into clear, concise, and actionable insights for stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Develop and implement data models to support business intelligence and reporting initiatives




We would like you to be…




Highly proficient in SQL and PySpark, with experience in data modeling for business intelligence
Experienced in traditional Machine Learning projects, including predictive modeling, classification, and clustering
Skilled in Python for data analytics, with the ability to implement and optimize models
Hands-on with Databricks or Dremio for large-scale data processing and analysis
Strong in data visualization, particularly with PowerBI or similar dashboarding tools
Familiar with Natural Language Processing (NLP) concepts and their application in customer insights (a plus)




Would you like to join…




A team that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning
An environment where your insights directly impact business decisions and customer satisfaction
A culture that encourages innovation and the sharing of ideas




Please note Designit can only consider applicants with the right to work in Denmark.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Software- & AI-ingeniør – Skab Frem­ti­dens AI-løsninger

 

Er du passioneret omkring kunstig intelligens og softwareudvikling? Brænder du for at omsætte AI-koncepter til konkrete løsninger? Så kom og bliv en del af vores team!




Vi søger en Software- & AI-ingeniør, der kan hjælpe os med at opbygge vores AI-afdeling og vores kunder med at realisere deres AI-drevne visioner.




Om rollen

I denne stilling vil du være vores primære AI-specialist, der har en central rolle i at drive udviklingen af intelligente løsninger til vores kunder. Du bliver en del af et stærkt softwareteam, hvor du kan sparre med kollegaer om softwareudvikling og kundebehov, men det er dig, der står for AI-delen.

Eksempler på nogle af de projekter, vi har i støbeskeen:

En AI-drevet "review bot", der hjælper kundeservicemedarbejdere med at formulere klare og effektive svar.
En chatbot baseret på Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), der gør det muligt for brugere at stille spørgsmål i stedet for at søge manuelt i dokumenter.
Udvikling af nye AI-løsninger, hvor du måske skal arbejde med real-time audio transcription og agentbaserede systemer.

Stillingen giver mulighed for at arbejde med de nyeste AI-teknologier, tage ansvar for AI-udviklingen og eksperimentere med innovative løsninger.




Dine primære opgaver

Udvikle og implementere AI-løsninger ved brug af LLM’er, AI-agenter og machine learning-teknikker, herunder metoder som fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG, ReACT og meta-prompting.
Udvikle API'er og softwareintegrationer for at forbinde AI-løsninger med eksisterende systemer.
Designe og optimere agentbaserede systemer, der automatiserer arbejdsgange ved hjælp af teknologier som LangChain, LangGraph og LangSmith.
Deploye, vedligeholde og skalere open-source LLM’er på lokale servere eller cloud-platforme (Azure AI Fundray, AWS, GCP).
Arbejde med data warehousing, data lakes eller lakehouses for at understøtte AI-drevne applikationer.
Lede os i produktinnovation og prototyping baseret på kundens behov.
Være i stand at opbygge og inspirere et AI team på sigt.
Holde dig opdateret på de nyeste AI-trends og eksperimentere med nye metoder.




Dine kvalifikationer

Solid erfaring med Python og AI/ML-biblioteker som PyTorch, TensorFlow eller LangChain.
Forståelse for machine learning og evnen til at skelne mellem ML-problemer og LLM-applikationer.
Erfaring med optimering af AI-modeller gennem metoder som fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG, ReACT, meta-prompting, prompt chaining, multiple vector search, graph prompting og lignende teknikker.
Kendskab til agentbaserede AI-systemer og hvordan de kan orkestrere komplekse arbejdsgange.
Kendskab til API-udvikling og softwareintegration.
En stærk vilje til at lære og arbejde med nye teknologier inden for AI.
Kendskab til AI-modellers evalueringsmetoder og optimeringsteknikker.
Du skal være i stand til at forstå og kommunikere klart på dansk, da vores kunder er danske.




Bonuskompetencer, som vil være en ekstra fordel

Erfaring med open-source AI-modeller og at få dem til at køre på lokale servere eller cloud-platforme.
Erfaring med cloud computing (Azure, AWS eller GCP).
Forståelse for data engineering-principper (SQL, NoSQL, ETL-pipelines).
Erfaring med real-time data processing, herunder transkribering af lyd og speech-to-text-teknologier.
Erfaring med web- eller app-udvikling.
C# erfaring




Vi tilbyder

Et dynamisk og innovativt arbejdsmiljø, hvor AI-løsninger er et nyt indsatsområde.
Et samarbejdsorienteret team, med engagerede kolleger, hvor du kan være med i alle faser fra idégenerering over udvikling til implementering.
Fleksible og gode arbejdsforhold, herunder mulighed for hjemmearbejde efter nærmere aftale.
Kundekontakt, så du kan se, hvad dine løsninger bidrager med.
Mulighed for videreuddannelse.
Korte beslutningsprocesser og frihed under ansvar, der giver dig gode muligheder for at tage ansvar og præge fremtidens løsninger.




Om os

Velkommen til MicroTech – et softwarehus, hvor teknologi møder forretningsforståelse, og hvor vi skaber skræddersyede løsninger i tæt samarbejde med vores kunder. Vi har 35+ års erfaring med at udvikle software, primært inden for bank og forsikring, men vi har også leveret løsninger til den offentlige sektor, produktionsvirksomheder og servicebranchen.




Vores tilgang er enkel: Kvalitet frem for kvantitet og altid med kundeoplevelsen i centrum. Vi tror på, at stærke løsninger opstår gennem dialog, forståelse og teknologisk nysgerrighed.




Vi har til huse i lækre lokaler i Aarhus med grønne planter og kunst på væggene. Letbanen og bus holder lige uden for døren, og kommer du på cykel eller i bil, er det også nemt.




Vi tænker også over den verden, vi er en del af. Bæredygtighed, etik og ansvarlighed er vigtige værdier for os, og vi giver gerne tilbage – både gennem sponsorater og initiativer, der skaber muligheder for dem, der har brug for det.




Hvis du er motiveret for at udvikle fremtidens AI-løsninger og vil arbejde i et miljø, hvor du bliver en vigtig spiller, så send din ansøgning i dag til jp@microtech.dk. Skriv AI-udvikler i emnefeltet. Hvis du har spørgsmål til os, er du velkommen til at kontakte os via mail eller på 7585 9444.

Show more

  • Forståelse for data engineering-principper (SQL, NoSQL, ETL-pipelines).
  • Erfaring med real-time data processing, herunder transkribering af lyd og speech-to-text-teknologier.
  • Erfaring med web- eller app-udvikling.
  • C# erfaring


Vi tilbyder

  • Et dynamisk og innovativt arbejdsmiljø, hvor AI-løsninger er et nyt indsatsområde.
  • Et samarbejdsorienteret team, med engagerede kolleger, hvor du kan være med i alle faser fra idégenerering over udvikling til implementering.
  • Fleksible og gode arbejdsforhold, herunder mulighed for hjemmearbejde efter nærmere aftale.
  • Kundekontakt, så du kan se, hvad dine løsninger bidrager med.
  • Mulighed for videreuddannelse.
  • Korte beslutningsprocesser og frihed under ansvar, der giver dig gode muligheder for at tage ansvar og præge fremtidens løsninger.


Om os

Velkommen til MicroTech – et softwarehus, hvor teknologi møder forretningsforståelse, og hvor vi skaber skræddersyede løsninger i tæt samarbejde med vores kunder. Vi har 35+ års erfaring med at udvikle software, primært inden for bank og forsikring, men vi har også leveret løsninger til den offentlige sektor, produktionsvirksomheder og servicebranchen.


Vores tilgang er enkel: Kvalitet frem for kvantitet og altid med kundeoplevelsen i centrum. Vi tror på, at stærke løsninger opstår gennem dialog, forståelse og teknologisk nysgerrighed.


Vi har til huse i lækre lokaler i Aarhus med grønne planter og kunst på væggene. Letbanen og bus holder lige uden for døren, og kommer du på cykel eller i bil, er det også nemt.


Vi tænker også over den verden, vi er en del af. Bæredygtighed, etik og ansvarlighed er vigtige værdier for os, og vi giver gerne tilbage – både gennem sponsorater og initiativer, der skaber muligheder for dem, der har brug for det.


Hvis du er motiveret for at udvikle fremtidens AI-løsninger og vil arbejde i et miljø, hvor du bliver en vigtig spiller, så send din ansøgning i dag til jp@microtech.dk. Skriv AI-udvikler i emnefeltet. Hvis du har spørgsmål til os, er du velkommen til at kontakte os via mail eller på 7585 9444.

Title: Data Scientist - AI & ML
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
ZS is a place where passion changes lives. As a management consulting and technology firm focused on improving life and how we live it, our most valuable asset is our people. Here you’ll work side-by-side with a powerful collective of thinkers and experts shaping life-changing solutions for patients, caregivers and consumers, worldwide. ZSers drive impact by bringing a client first mentality to each and every engagement. We partner collaboratively with our clients to develop custom solutions and technology products that create value and deliver company results across critical areas of their business. Bring your curiosity for learning; bold ideas; courage and passion to drive life-changing impact to ZS.

Our most valuable asset is our people.

At ZS we honor the visible and invisible elements of our identities, personal experiences and belief systems—the ones that comprise us as individuals, shape who we are and

make us unique. We believe your personal interests, identities, and desire to learn are part of your success here. Learn more about our diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts and the networks ZS supports to assist our ZSers in cultivating community spaces, obtaining the resources they need to thrive, and sharing the messages they are passionate about.

We are seeking a talented and experienced Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and deploying AI/ML models, optimizing data pipelines, and ensuring compliance with regulatory standards to support clients strategic business decisions.

What You’ll Do


Advanced Analytics & AI/ML Development
Build and deploy AI/ML models to support business decisions across various domains.
Apply predictive analytics for forecasting, optimization, and automation.
Develop solutions using natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, or generative AI where applicable.
Data Engineering & MLOps
Work with structured and unstructured data from multiple sources to derive insights.
Implement scalable data pipelines, model deployment, and monitoring systems.
Optimize model performance and ensure reproducibility and reliability.
Regulatory & Compliance Alignment
Ensure adherence to GxP, FAIR data principles, and relevant regulatory guidelines.
Maintain high standards of model explainability and governance to meet compliance requirements.


What You'll Bring


6-10 years operating as a hands on Data Scientist within either consultancy or life sciences/healthcare analytics.
Advanced degree (Master’s/PhD) in Data Science, AI, Computer Science, or related fields.
Strong expertise in Python, R, SQL, Spark, and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure).
Experience in MLOps, data engineering, and end-to-end model lifecycle management.
Knowledge of GxP, ITIL, and compliance aspects for AI in pharma.
Familiarity with clinical commercial analytics, supply chain optimization, or HR analytics depending on domain focus.
Experience working with multinational teams and enterprise-wide data ecosystems.


Perks & Benefits:

ZS offers a comprehensive total rewards package including health and well-being, financial planning, annual leave, personal growth and professional development. Our robust skills development programs, multiple career progression options and internal mobility paths and collaborative culture empowers you to thrive as an individual and global team member.

We are committed to giving our employees a flexible and connected way of working. A flexible and connected ZS allows us to combine work from home and on-site presence at clients/ZS offices for the majority of our week. The magic of ZS culture and innovation thrives in both planned and spontaneous face-to-face connections.

Travel:

Travel is a requirement at ZS for client facing ZSers; business needs of your project and client are the priority. While some projects may be local, all client-facing ZSers should be prepared to travel as needed. Travel provides opportunities to strengthen client relationships, gain diverse experiences, and enhance professional growth by working in different environments and cultures.

Considering applying?

At ZS, we're building a diverse and inclusive company where people bring their passions to inspire life-changing impact and deliver better outcomes for all. We are most interested in finding the best candidate for the job and recognize the value that candidates with all backgrounds, including non-traditional ones, bring. If you are interested in joining us, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements listed above.

ZS is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment and advancement opportunities without regard to any class protected by applicable law.

To Complete Your Application:

Candidates must possess or be able to obtain work authorization for their intended country of employment.An on-line application, including a full set of transcripts (official or unofficial), is required to be considered.

NO AGENCY CALLS, PLEASE.

Find Out More At:

www.zs.com
Show more

Title: Student Data Scientist / Data analyst – Join a Fast-Growing Scale-Up!
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Student Data Scientist – Join a Fast-Growing Scale-Up!

Are you passionate about uncovering business opportunities through data? Do you want to be part of a fast-growing company where your skills will make a real impact? If so, we have the perfect student job for you!

Legal Desk: Innovation, Growth & A Great Place to Work

At Legal Desk, we are transforming the legal industry through automation, making legal services more accessible and affordable for individuals and businesses across the Nordics.

As Denmark’s leading provider of automated legal services, we help form over 30% of all new Limited liability companies in Denmark and are expanding into Sweden and Norway. With 275,000+ users, our growth is accelerating - and we want you to be part of the journey!

At Legal Desk, we believe that innovation, creativity, and ownership fuel success. As a Student Data Scientist, you’ll gain hands-on experience in a dynamic, supportive, and fast-moving environment, all while having the flexibility to balance work with your studies.

If you're ready to apply your skills to real-world challenges and grow in a company that values your development, then let’s talk! 🚀

Shape the Future of Data at Legal Desk

As our Student Data Scientist, you’ll play a key role in transforming our data into powerful insights that drive smarter decision-making. Your work will involve integrating diverse data sources (GA4, Virk open data, internal databases, etc.) into dynamic dashboards, helping uncover key insights, solve business challenges, and improve our platform’s performance.

If you love working with data, thrive in a fast-paced startup environment, and want to make a real impact, we want to hear from you!

What You’ll Do


Identify business challenges and opportunities and translate them into meaningful visualizations.
Analyze data to optimize business operations and improve the customer experience. Build data models and visualizations, primarily for dashboards.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders in marketing and UX to collect, process, and integrate data from multiple sources.


Who You Are


Currently pursuing a Master’s degree in Data Science or a related field
A strategic thinker with a business-oriented mindset
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, startup environment
You live in Sweden or Denmark, and you are able to work from our physical office in Copenhagen. Work from home is optional from time to time, however we find it important that you are a part of the social culture in Legal Desk, why you must be able to work form the physical office.


Your Technical Skills

Must haves:


Python – Very proficient (3+ years, including academic experience)
Strong understanding of Python and database structures
Experience with key Python libraries: Pandas. Plotting libraries (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly)
SQL experienced + basic knowledge of data-base structures


Nice to have


Familiarity with Git (basic experience required)
Basic web scraping knowledge
Basic understanding of HTML & CSS
Basic knowledge of BI dashboard principles
Experience with Google Analytics (GA4) and Looker is a plus, but not required
Experience with Streamlit (Python module) is a plus, but not required


Why Join Us?

At Legal Desk, we offer a flexible work environment that adapts to your studies, allowing you to balance your education with real-world experience. You’ll work alongside a vibrant team of students, gaining hands-on experience in a supportive and innovative environment.

But it’s not just about work - you’ll also get to be part of our thriving social culture! From company trips to some of our many Friday bars, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to connect, collaborate, and have fun with your colleagues.

If you’re excited about using data to drive meaningful change - apply today! 🚀

Write a very brief motivational letter along with your CV.

DEADLINE: Monday 5th May 2025
Show more

Title: Data Scientist, Lystrup
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to push the boundaries of AI and Machine Learning, building intelligent solutions that make a real impact for the Defense Industry?

Terma is at the forefront of an exciting journey, marked by growth, innovation, and the delivery of mission-critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industries. Our technologies provide safety and security for people on land, at sea, and in the air. In space, we contribute to pioneering missions that address emerging global challenges.

To support this mission, we are seeking a Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team. This is more than just a job – it’s an opportunity to shape the future of defense technology and contribute to a safer world.

Your role in our team

Since early 2022, the global security landscape has evolved rapidly. Denmark, together with its NATO allies, is facing increasing challenges that demand innovative solutions. In this dynamic environment, the ability to deliver cutting-edge technology swiftly is essential. At Terma’s Advanced Analytics team, we develop and maintain AI-driven solutions that support decision-making and enhance situational awareness.

We are a passionate and dedicated team that takes full ownership of our AI products – from ideation to delivery and maintenance. Our work goes beyond coding; we collaborate closely with our customers to understand their needs, ensuring that our solutions make a real impact. This means you will engage directly with end users, gaining insights that go far beyond the traditional developer role.

You will be part of a team that values innovation, diversity, and psychological safety. We support and challenge each other, fostering an environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to meaningful solutions.

How you will make a meaningful contribution

As a Data Scientist At Terma, You Will


Develop advanced AI solutions – Work with sometimes large and sometimes small amount of data, leveraging deep learning models to push the boundaries of what’s possible.
Take ownership for data and AI modeling for key projects – Take responsibility for AI solutions that address real-world challenges in multi-domain operations (maritime, land, air, space, and cyberspace).
Ensure top-tier quality and security – You’ll be handling classified information and mission-critical systems, requiring both innovation and adherence to military-grade security standards.
Collaborate and engage with end users – Your work will directly impact defense operations, so understanding real-world applications is crucial.


This role is perfect for someone who is eager to take on responsibility, think outside the box, and be part of a team that values both skill and dedication.

Bring your world class expertise into play

Mindset And Team Culture


You believe in teamwork and thrive in an environment built on mutual trust and collaboration.
You take ownership of your work, embracing challenges with a problem-solving mindset.
You are motivated by the impact of your work and excited about developing solutions that truly matter.
You enjoy an informal but professional work culture where ideas are shared, and learning is continuous.


Education & Experience


A degree in Engineering, Physics, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Strong technical skills, including proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and AI/ML frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Experience with AI/ML deployment, programming (Python), data manipulation, and visualization tools.
Familiarity with Linux environments and containerization tools such as Docker.


Most importantly, we value passion and creativity – if you have funny hobby projects or unique experiences, we want to hear about them!

At Terma, you will be part of a company that not only pushes technological boundaries but also values its people. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute. If you are ready to take on exciting challenges, grow professionally, and be part of a team that makes a difference, we encourage you to apply.

Let’s build the future of defense technology together!

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Benefits at Terma

At Terma, we prioritize the well-being of our employees, ensuring they are well taken care of. Joining our team comes with a multitude of perks designed to enhance your social life, cultural experiences, and health.

Development Opportunities: Benefit from a personalized development plan, access to our e-learning program, and specific career courses.

International Environment: Explore career opportunities with colleagues around the world.

Flexible Working Hours: Enjoy the opportunity to work flexible and the option to work from home up to two days per week. Internet connection at home is paid by Terma.

Comprehensive Benefits Package: Receive a 10% paid pension along with a beneficial health care and insurance package. Enjoy discounts from various business partners.

Well-being Perks: Opportunity to enroll in our on-site massage-offer

Social and Professional Events: Participate in various events including sports and talks, and join our book club, bicycle club, student network, wine club, motorcycle club, and more.

Competence networking across professional experts in Terma: Professional presentations and knowledge sharing across the organization

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

We encourage all individuals to apply for our job openings, as we are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to these DEIB principles means we value and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of each team member. We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.

We do not expect you to write an application, but please send us a motivated resume. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com. Applications will be processed continuously.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Any unanswered questions?

Feel free to contact Hiring Manager on this e-mail: MJLA@terma.com in case of any further questions regarding this position.

Bear in mind that candidates for this position must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defense Intelligence Service. This entails that the candidate, as a minimum, have stayed within NATO/EU for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad.

The Denmark based high-tech Terma Group develops products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation

The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.

Headquartered in Aarhus, Denmark, Terma has subsidiaries and operations across Europe, in the Middle East, in Asia Pacific as well as a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary, Terma Inc., with offices in Washington D.C., Georgia and Texas.

Application deadline:

As soon as possible

Title: Data Scientist, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

As a Data Scientist and Senior Data Scientist, you'll be part of our rapidly growing team. You'll have the chance to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, scrappy, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Talented Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Transforming Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Student Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Student Machine Learning Engineer

At MFT Energy, we are at the forefront of energy trading, driving market efficiency, and facilitating the green transition. We are seeking a talented student machine learning engineer to join our ambitious Intraday team trading European power. Collaborate with experienced professionals, who are dedicated to excellence every day.

About The Role

As a Student Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in our dynamic Intraday team. You will work alongside highly skilled quantitative analysts, machine-learning experts, execution-algo developers, system developers, and traders.

Your work will directly influence our critical frameworks, positioning you at the heart of our operations. You will be instrumental in ensuring that the data flows continuously, the frameworks are robust, and general systems are always running. Over time, your responsibilities will grow as we believe in responsibility being a key driver for your success.

Your Key Responsibilities


Maintain and extend machine learning frameworks.
Acquire and maintain data from external sources.


Your Qualifications And Personal Skills


Studying: Computer Science, Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or similar.
A general interest in technology and systems.
Experience with Python and standard libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, etc.
Familiarity with Linux environments and containerization tools such as Docker.
Experience with common software technologies such as Git, SQL, Azure, and general observability tools is considered a plus.
A proactive approach and an eye for detail.
The ability to work independently and structure your workload.
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English.


Above all, we cherish passion and creativity. If yo have made hobby projects, feel free to share them.

Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We are more than 190 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Türkiye, Australia, New York City, and Singapore, and several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best—we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.

We Offer


A part-time student position with a high degree of influence and autonomy, requiring on-site presence at our Aarhus C office to foster close collaboration and learning
A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment.
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions.
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach.
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.


Make the Most of Your Talent! Join us!

If you believe there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we look forward to receiving your application, accompanied by a CV, a short cover letter, and your transcript. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.

Deadline: As soon as possible.

Start date: Flexible.

We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

As a global and independent energy trading hub, we specialize in power, gas, and environmentals trading 24/7 in 41 countries. At MFT Energy, we innovate energy trading through our people and technology, supported by our unique partner model. Our belief is that fostering a sense of ownership among employees is the most effective way to advance our business.
Show more

Title: Seeking a Process Data Scientist to our Process Science Analytics Team
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Process Data Scientist to help us translate our manufacturing and supporting processes pain points, into first class Manufacturing Intelligence Use Cases via data analytics /science. If you thrive by being a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data, then you just might be a great colleague to our highly skilled Process Analytics organization.

Your New Role

The Process Data Scientist is a critical role within FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) as the business is expanding and we are introducing new technologies, programs, and customers continuously – with data excellence being one of the mission enablers. We will provide ongoing support to our new site in Holly Springs, NC, USA.

You will be a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data usage and analytics value chain, whilst being the owner of already validated monitoring applications, e.g., an electronic chromatogram review setup and machine learning batch performance models. We continuously strive to identify opportunities to improve internal systems and practices, as well as provide direction and development of digital/data offerings to our partners.

Your Primary Tasks Will Be


Support process investigations, root cause analysis, optimization with data support and analysis
Process Analytics systems support to manufacturing across all product modalities
Develop, validate, and deploy ETL pipelines and help build the process data ecosystem
Support process trending, continued process verification (CPV) and annual product reviews (APQR)
Support development of applications with models for process characterization and scale-up/out
Develop, validate, and deploy multivariate batch monitoring models
Support innovation and systems improvement initiatives in the Process Analytics space



The Skills & Knowledge We Hope You Possess


You have a master’s degree in in a relevant science or engineering discipline (i.e., Engineering, Bioinformatics or similar) with 2 years of industry experience or a Bachelors in the same area with 4 years of industry experience.
You have working-knowledge of SQL and a solid understanding of data science and the Python data science ecosystem (NumPy, SciPy, pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebook).
Familiarity with SIMCA-online, TIBCO Statistica, Visual Basic and Git version control are a plus.
It would be considered an advantage if you also have GMP experience, having worked on delivering GxP applications.



We value candidates who are naturally curious, greet people with a smile, and possess a can-do attitude. You demonstrate humility and respect for those around you. As someone who is pragmatic and structured, you have a keen focus on quality and enjoy working independently. You are proactive in dynamic entrepreneurial environments. Most importantly, you possess strong communication skills and appreciate the support of a cross-functional team.

The team

The Process Analytics team is embedded in the Process Science (PS) organization and provide leadership and subject matter expertise to existing production-ready process data business processes, while also seeking to develop and introduce new Manufacturing Intelligence in clinical, PPQ and commercial processes primarily in the large-scale Cell Culture manufacturing.

We are a growing team of highly professional dedicated scientists/engineers with data management and data science expertise - but also broad experience within pharmaceutical development and manufacturing of monoclonal antibodies.

The work environment is international and informal. The role is based in our Hillerød, Denmark location, and we offer a flexible work arrangement where a defined number of working hours can be carried out in the employee’s home.

We keep a high pace and focus on a vital work life balance while having fun. We put a strong emphasis on psychological safety through trust and empowerment within our teams and hope that this is something that speaks to you as well.

Application

Has this sparked your interest, then please upload your CV and cover letter as soon as possible, as we screen candidates on a continuous basis and call in for interviews.

The Company

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication, and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Title: Experienced Data Scientist - Generative AI and Machine Learning
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
emagine is seeking an experience Data Scientist to develop Generative AI and Machine Learning (ML) scenarios in the Financial Crime Prevention domain for a client in the financial / banking sector.

Must haves:


Expert-level experience in developing Generative AI (LLM) and/or Machine Learning solutions in the Financial Crime domain
Experience working with rapid development efforts of complex large scale digital products in the Financial Crime domain
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
Extensive experience of similar work at other international banks.


Crucial skills:


Change management
Program management
Data science.


Other details:

Location: Høje-Taastrup, Denmark

Workload: Full-time + hybrid

Start date: 28.04.2025

End date: 31.12.2025
