Title: Machine Learning Infrastructure Engineer
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, designing robust and scalable software infrastructure, and collaborating with dedicated colleagues — all while playing a key role in scaling our business even further.




Does this sound exciting? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Infrastructure Engineer at Alipes Capital.




At Alipes Capital, we have been a market leader in automating financial markets since our inception in 2008, pioneering fully automated natural language processing systems to read and interpret financial news.




To accomplish our goal of being the best at what we do, we are focused on building a world-class ML engineering workflow, ensuring seamless training, deployment and monitoring of our predictive models. Your work will be instrumental in further developing the infrastructure that transforms massive unstructured financial data sets into production-ready inference models that drive real-time trading decisions.




In doing so, you will get a chance to help develop scalable, high-performance ML systems, ensuring a seamless pipeline from dataset generation through model prototyping to production deployment.




Key responsibilities include:

Designing and optimizing infrastructure to support distributed model training and experiment tracking
Building and automating robust data pipelines for dataset generation and feature engineering, while enabling data version control
Developing software for rapid experimentation and deployment, including automated testing, continuous integration, and delivery
Implementing best practices in software development, ensuring maintainability, scalability, and efficiency of ML systems through automated testing and real-time monitoring,
Improving model deployment workflows, focusing on minimizing latency, ensuring reproducibility, and enabling fast iterations




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.




About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with passionate quantitative researchers covering 8 nationalities – fourteen PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and are willing to engage on a deep, technical level of understanding.




About you

Fluency with computer science fundamentals – data structures and algorithms
Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets and training distributed models
Experience with Python, in particular the data preprocessing, ETL pipelines and distributed systems
Familiarity with strongly typed languages like C# or C/C++ or Rust
A few years of experience in production-grade environments working with the full Machine Learning stack from dataset generation through model training and real-life validation and monitoring
Experience with distributed computing frameworks (for example Spark, Ray or Dask)
Familiarity with containerization technologies (for example Docker Compose or Kubernetes)




Nice to have

A scientific and inquisitive mind
Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
Familiarity with algorithmic trading concepts
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics or physics




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in Nordhavn with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.




If you have specific questions about the role, you are welcome to email us at quant_jobs@alipescapital.com. Please do not send in your applications to this email address, as our interview team will not have visibility to review.

To accomplish our goal of being the best at what we do, we are focused on building a world-class ML engineering workflow, ensuring seamless training, deployment and monitoring of our predictive models. Your work will be instrumental in further developing the infrastructure that transforms massive unstructured financial data sets into production-ready inference models that drive real-time trading decisions.


In doing so, you will get a chance to help develop scalable, high-performance ML systems, ensuring a seamless pipeline from dataset generation through model prototyping to production deployment.


Key responsibilities include:

  • Designing and optimizing infrastructure to support distributed model training and experiment tracking
  • Building and automating robust data pipelines for dataset generation and feature engineering, while enabling data version control
  • Developing software for rapid experimentation and deployment, including automated testing, continuous integration, and delivery
  • Implementing best practices in software development, ensuring maintainability, scalability, and efficiency of ML systems through automated testing and real-time monitoring,
  • Improving model deployment workflows, focusing on minimizing latency, ensuring reproducibility, and enabling fast iterations


You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.


About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with passionate quantitative researchers covering 8 nationalities – fourteen PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and are willing to engage on a deep, technical level of understanding.


About you

  • Fluency with computer science fundamentals – data structures and algorithms
  • Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets and training distributed models
  • Experience with Python, in particular the data preprocessing, ETL pipelines and distributed systems
  • Familiarity with strongly typed languages like C# or C/C++ or Rust
  • A few years of experience in production-grade environments working with the full Machine Learning stack from dataset generation through model training and real-life validation and monitoring
  • Experience with distributed computing frameworks (for example Spark, Ray or Dask)
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies (for example Docker Compose or Kubernetes)


Nice to have

  • A scientific and inquisitive mind
  • Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
  • Familiarity with algorithmic trading concepts
  • PhD or MSc degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics or physics


What we can offer you

  • Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
  • Exciting problems to solve
  • Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
  • Nice office in Nordhavn with a hybrid work model
  • Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation


Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.


If you have specific questions about the role, you are welcome to email us at quant_jobs@alipescapital.com. Please do not send in your applications to this email address, as our interview team will not have visibility to review.

Title: Senior Backend Developer (Python)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Game Analytics

GameAnalytics is a leading analytics tool for anyone building a mobile game. Our platform helps everyone in the industry, from indie developers, to growing games studios, to global publishers. Our network includes more than 100k games, which are played by north of 2 billion people each month. That's more than ⅓ of the world's mobile gamers. What's our mission? To help game developers make the right decisions based on data. And by joining our team, you'll be working on new and innovative products to help tens of thousands of people in the industry do just that.

About The Team

You will join our backend API development team, currently working out of our Copenhagen office. Together you'll be working on some of our most critical APIs handling authentication, authorisation and the business logic for all our users, studios & games, providing the backbone that powers our web application. We work using a modern development stack (Python 3, MySQL, Terraform, ECS/Fargate), use cloud technologies (AWS, GCP) and we value simplicity, code quality, automation; with the aim of iterating fast and delivering value. We have major new product offerings in development and the team will be involved in all areas of planning, designing and development.

What we are looking for


As an experienced developer you will be a key contributor involved in planning, designing and developing current and new product offerings
Making sure we build the right thing at the right time. We value the ability to make reasonable and informed decisions with minimal supervision
Be able to take ownership (together with the other team members) of several APIs (currently based on Python), our main user management database or any future production critical systems
Managing AWS resources and deployment procedures in collaboration with our other engineering teams
Keeping code quality high using code reviews (pull requests) and documented coding standards
Ability to collaborate and communicate well with other teams, including product and support
Understanding of business processes and data governance implications, when working with customer accounts
Train, coach and support hiring of team members



Requirements


Essential:


Excellent understanding of Python OR an excellent understanding of another backend related language (Java, Erlang, Elixir, Golang, Ruby...) AND some Python experience
Excellent understanding of API development; including best practices, industry standards, performance implications..
3+ years of experience building and managing production systems
Experience with SQL and RDBMS concepts, using these on large projects, preferably using MySQL or PostgreSQL
Ability to write high quality and maintainable code, only embracing complexity when truly needed. Approach coding so that others can read and work with your code
Experience with modern development life cycle, including automated testing and deployment
Excellent communication and team collaboration skills
Experience with developing software in a cloud environment, preferably in AWS



Desirable:


A degree in computer science or equivalent
Good knowledge of FastAPI, Flask or other Python API frameworks
Knowledge of SQLAlchemy or other ORM frameworks
Experience with infrastructure-as-code systems (Terraform, Ansible, etc.)
Experience with containerized applications (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS/Fargate or similar)
Comfortable working in a Linux environment
Experience with, or interest in, other programming languages besides Python
Experience with authentication/authorization protocols, such as OAuth2
An interest in project management and software development methodologies
Passion in videogames and the industry



Benefits


Working flexibility
(When in office) Food, snacks and drinks
25 Days paid holiday (excluding bank holiday)
Year-end office closure (paid holiday downtime between Christmas and New Year's)
Company sickness leave
Carers' leave
Additional compassionate leave
"Work-from-Anywhere" Scheme (15 days per year)
Learning budgets
Monthly social nights
Expense phone bill
Show more

Title: Full-stack Developer – customized code, AI and machine learning
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want a role as trusted advisor, where you will help our customers with a range of challenges focusing on delivering customized code tailored to each project? And are you passionate about working with AI and machine learning? Then you are the new colleague, we are looking for. This position is based at our office in Viby or in Nordhavn in Copenhagen with the flexibility to work from home.

Lead efficient and customized full-stack development solutions
You will be part of our Custom Software team, where we provide expert advice on software design and development. We help different customers in Denmark achieving digital transformation by analyzing business challenges and building custom software solutions to realize their visions.

As Full-stack Developer you will be responsible for designing and building complete software solutions ranging from setting up cloud infrastructure in Microsoft Azure; to developing robust, expressive, and well-tested backend code; as well as building accessible and flexible UIs. You will also have the opportunity to build AI-powered agents and applications.

Overall, your areas of responsibility will include:

Investigating customer needs to find the best fit software solution
Designing and architecting systems from front to back
Developing high-quality software that provides value to our customers
Monitoring and maintaining running software
Renovating legacy software to match new needs and challenges
Working with a range of technologies, languages, and frameworks to provide value across the whole stack
Working with AI to build powerful agents and tools to push our clients forward

Some of the skills we are interested in:

3+ years of experience in software development / full-stack development
A relevant bachelor’s or master’s degree within Computer Science or similar
Experience interacting with end customers
Experience with C# and .NET development
Experience working with web frontend frameworks and libraries such as Angular, React, HTMX and any others
Experience with cloud architecture and Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of or interest in project management
General good technical understanding and insight
Fluent in English – Danish is a plus but not a must

We understand that working with software involves an impossible number of technologies and frameworks to master, so don’t worry if you haven’t worked with every tool listed – we’d still love to hear from you!

Personal qualifications:

A skilled communicator: good at listening and building common understanding
A reasoned approach to decision making – you can consider the options available against the constraints of a task instead of just copy/pasting the same solution
Curiosity about how different parts of software fit together and how to build things from scratch
A knack for debugging and finding the causes of errors
Structured and diligent, you have the details covered
A team player, happy to work alongside your colleagues so we can build and improve together

What we can offer you:

Interesting and varied work: we have customers from many different industries that need software for different purposes
A hybrid workplace – a lot in the team work remotely for most of the week, but we group up when we want to run in person discussions or regularly on Fridays so we can keep regular contact with all our colleagues
Skilled and knowledgeable colleagues and the opportunity to learn and grow together
Opportunities for development: we want you to be the best you can be, and we attend conferences, run hackathons, maintain a solid library of professional literature and are always on the lookout for better ways that we can develop our skills
Social events, professional gatherings, and 1,700 amazing teamm8s as colleagues

Ready to be part of itm8?

We’re looking forward to receiving your CV.

If you have questions concerning the position, please feel free to contact Software Architect, Custom Software Adam Guest at phone +45 2493 9060 or e-mail adgue@itm8.com or TA Partner Trine Larsen at phone +45 2815 5806 or e-mail trlar@itm8.com.

All inquiries are treated confidentially. We hold ongoing interviews and complete the recruitment process when the right candidate is found. Furthermore, we obtain a criminal record prior to employment.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Show more

Title: Application Engineer
Description:
Application Engineer søges til Nordcad




Er du vores nye kollega?




Vi søger en Application Engineer, som skal fungere som vores kunders foretrukne sparringspartner. Du skal derfor trives med både kundekontakt, og teknisk og kompleks udvikling af elektronik systemer. Er du utålmodig og måldrevet af natur? Er du nysgerrig, og har du altid haft teknisk flair? Kan du lide at præsentere og rådgive?




Så skal du læse videre!

Timer: Fuldtid

Tiltrædelse: August (vi starter screeninger allerede nu, og afholder løbende samtaler)

Arbejdssted: Aalborg







Hvis du kan genkende dette, så er det dig vi leder efter!

Du er utrolig måldrevet. Du elsker et klart mål og en klar retning, og der findes nærmest ingen bedre følelse end at nå de mål, du har sat dig. Du elsker at føle dig effektiv, og at udrette noget.
Du er utålmodig af natur. Du får et stort energiboost, når du får lov til at igangsætte ting. Du er heller ikke bange for det uventede, og du har næsten altid været god til at håndtere det uforudsete.
Når du har lavet en aftale, tager du 100% ansvar for den. Du føler nærmest et psykologisk ejerskab over dine forpligtelser, da du ikke kan lide uforløste ting på dit bord.
Du drives af at få et smil frem hos andre, og du bærer det altid rundt selv. Du bruger måske humor, eller har let til smil, og du har meget nemt ved at finde de positive vinkler på ting.
Du er motiveret af uforudsigelighed og udfordringer, og så er du også ret kreativ af natur. Når andre står med problemer, så finder du forløsning og motivation ved at hjælpe dem med at fikse tingene. Du er motiveret af kompleksitet.
Du kan hurtigt forholde dig til ny viden, og hvad den betyder. Du er nysgerrig, og hurtig til at lære nyt og sætte det i brug bagefter. Du finder det generelt stimulerende at lære nyt.
Du er selvsikker i dine tanker og beslutninger, og når du formidler, lytter andre. Du er overbevisende og troværdig, da du har styr på dine ting, og ved hvad du snakker om.







Dine ansvarsområder vil være:

Hjælpe kunder godt i gang med diverse tools og systemer.
Lave analysearbejde for kunderne, og hjælpe med at skræddersy forskellige løsninger.
Udvikle nye produkter med teamet og kunderne.
Udarbejde og fremvise produktpræsentationer og tekniske demoer i Norden.
Udarbejde og afholde webinarer.
Generelt at besøge kunder og identificere tekniske behov, for at starte nye projekter op og hjælpe kunderne godt i gang.







Hvad vi forventer af dig:

Flydende dansk & engelsk. Du føler dig komfortabel med samtaler på dansk/norsk/svensk.
Du har som minimum en bacheloruddannelse indenfor elektronik. Det er en fordel at have arbejdet med simulering, og du har praktisk erfaring med elektronik design.
Du har gerne taget en længerevarende uddannelse inden for elektronik, og du skal helst have arbejdet med elektronik udvikling i nogle år. Kunderne skal kunne mærke trygheden i, at du har stået med tingene i hænderne selv, og du derfor ved hvad du snakker om.
Du har lyst til at rejse i de nordiske lande (30-50 dage om året), og du kan selv stille bil til rådighed.







Om Nordcad og teamkulturen

Nordcad er en førende leverandør af software til elektronik industrien i Norden.

Vi har eksisteret siden 1987, og har i dag også selskaber i Norge, Sverige og Finland. Vi sælger software for Cadence, som er en af verdens førende software producenter. Vi er i øjeblikket 20 medarbejdere, der arbejder på at hjælpe blandt andet elektronikindustrien med at være forrest på teknologi.




Vi er en stærk partner til vores kunder, fordi vi går meget op i at levere den nyeste knowhow, og så kan vi rigtig godt lide at rådgive vores kunder. Vi skal være deres Go-To, altid.




Vores kultur bærer præg af ’Frihed under ansvar’ – og hvad mener vi så med det?

Vi ansætter folk som vi stoler på, kan deres kram. Og det man ikke kan på forhånd, det lærer vi dem. Vi går ind for autonomi, og for at skabe en hverdag hvor man trives under det ansvar man har. Når man får energi af at løse sine opgaver, så oplever vi at medarbejderne naturligt tager mere medansvar, og at kvaliteten altid er høj.




Kulturen hos os er en god blanding af en morgenhilsen ved kaffemaskinen, og et fælles drive om at levere service fra den øverste skuffe. Vi er både sociale og hårdtarbejdende, fordi vi mener man godt kan have det sjovt, imens man leverer 100%.







Hvad vi tilbyder

Et arbejdsmiljø hvor vi forsøger at forstå dig, på en sådan måde, at vi kan spille dig bedst muligt god ift. opgaver, ledelsesstil og teamkultur
Mulighed for at blive en del af den danske afdeling i en international koncern
Sociale arrangementer hver måned







Test i rekrutteringsprocessen

I rekrutteringsprocessen bruger vi talenttest. Du vil derfor i løbet af processen modtage et link til testen.

I testen handler det ikke om at svare rigtigt eller forkert, men om at afdække hvorvidt din naturlige adfærd og styrker matcher den kontekst du skal arbejde i.

Kan du genkende dig selv i opslaget? Så ser vi frem til at høre fra dig!







Spørgsmål

Har du nogle spørgsmål, så kontakt venligst:




Rasmus Schelde-Bollin

Recruitment & Talent Specialist

TalentX

Tlf: 4073 4627

Mail: rasmus@talentx.dk

Show more
HTML:
Application Engineer søges til Nordcad


Er du vores nye kollega?


Vi søger en Application Engineer, som skal fungere som vores kunders foretrukne sparringspartner. Du skal derfor trives med både kundekontakt, og teknisk og kompleks udvikling af elektronik systemer. Er du utålmodig og måldrevet af natur? Er du nysgerrig, og har du altid haft teknisk flair? Kan du lide at præsentere og rådgive?


Så skal du læse videre!

Timer: Fuldtid

Tiltrædelse: August (vi starter screeninger allerede nu, og afholder løbende samtaler)

Arbejdssted: Aalborg



Hvis du kan genkende dette, så er det dig vi leder efter!

  • Du er utrolig måldrevet. Du elsker et klart mål og en klar retning, og der findes nærmest ingen bedre følelse end at nå de mål, du har sat dig. Du elsker at føle dig effektiv, og at udrette noget.
  • Du er utålmodig af natur. Du får et stort energiboost, når du får lov til at igangsætte ting. Du er heller ikke bange for det uventede, og du har næsten altid været god til at håndtere det uforudsete.
  • Når du har lavet en aftale, tager du 100% ansvar for den. Du føler nærmest et psykologisk ejerskab over dine forpligtelser, da du ikke kan lide uforløste ting på dit bord.
  • Du drives af at få et smil frem hos andre, og du bærer det altid rundt selv. Du bruger måske humor, eller har let til smil, og du har meget nemt ved at finde de positive vinkler på ting.
  • Du er motiveret af uforudsigelighed og udfordringer, og så er du også ret kreativ af natur. Når andre står med problemer, så finder du forløsning og motivation ved at hjælpe dem med at fikse tingene. Du er motiveret af kompleksitet.
  • Du kan hurtigt forholde dig til ny viden, og hvad den betyder. Du er nysgerrig, og hurtig til at lære nyt og sætte det i brug bagefter. Du finder det generelt stimulerende at lære nyt.
  • Du er selvsikker i dine tanker og beslutninger, og når du formidler, lytter andre. Du er overbevisende og troværdig, da du har styr på dine ting, og ved hvad du snakker om.



Dine ansvarsområder vil være:

  • Hjælpe kunder godt i gang med diverse tools og systemer.
  • Lave analysearbejde for kunderne, og hjælpe med at skræddersy forskellige løsninger.
  • Udvikle nye produkter med teamet og kunderne.
  • Udarbejde og fremvise produktpræsentationer og tekniske demoer i Norden.
  • Udarbejde og afholde webinarer.
  • Generelt at besøge kunder og identificere tekniske behov, for at starte nye projekter op og hjælpe kunderne godt i gang.



Hvad vi forventer af dig:

  • Flydende dansk & engelsk. Du føler dig komfortabel med samtaler på dansk/norsk/svensk.
  • Du har som minimum en bacheloruddannelse indenfor elektronik. Det er en fordel at have arbejdet med simulering, og du har praktisk erfaring med elektronik design.
  • Du har gerne taget en længerevarende uddannelse inden for elektronik, og du skal helst have arbejdet med elektronik udvikling i nogle år. Kunderne skal kunne mærke trygheden i, at du har stået med tingene i hænderne selv, og du derfor ved hvad du snakker om.
  • Du har lyst til at rejse i de nordiske lande (30-50 dage om året), og du kan selv stille bil til rådighed.



Om Nordcad og teamkulturen

Nordcad er en førende leverandør af software til elektronik industrien i Norden.

Vi har eksisteret siden 1987, og har i dag også selskaber i Norge, Sverige og Finland. Vi sælger software for Cadence, som er en af verdens førende software producenter. Vi er i øjeblikket 20 medarbejdere, der arbejder på at hjælpe blandt andet elektronikindustrien med at være forrest på teknologi.


Vi er en stærk partner til vores kunder, fordi vi går meget op i at levere den nyeste knowhow, og så kan vi rigtig godt lide at rådgive vores kunder. Vi skal være deres Go-To, altid.


Vores kultur bærer præg af ’Frihed under ansvar’ – og hvad mener vi så med det?

Vi ansætter folk som vi stoler på, kan deres kram. Og det man ikke kan på forhånd, det lærer vi dem. Vi går ind for autonomi, og for at skabe en hverdag hvor man trives under det ansvar man har. Når man får energi af at løse sine opgaver, så oplever vi at medarbejderne naturligt tager mere medansvar, og at kvaliteten altid er høj.


Kulturen hos os er en god blanding af en morgenhilsen ved kaffemaskinen, og et fælles drive om at levere service fra den øverste skuffe. Vi er både sociale og hårdtarbejdende, fordi vi mener man godt kan have det sjovt, imens man leverer 100%.



Hvad vi tilbyder

  • Et arbejdsmiljø hvor vi forsøger at forstå dig, på en sådan måde, at vi kan spille dig bedst muligt god ift. opgaver, ledelsesstil og teamkultur
  • Mulighed for at blive en del af den danske afdeling i en international koncern
  • Sociale arrangementer hver måned

Title: M.Sc project in Artificial Intelligence Researcher
Company: Department of Plant and Environmental Sciences, University of Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Master’s Thesis Project Opportunity: Artificial Intelligence used for Protein Function & Interaction Prediction




We are looking for a motivated Master’s student to explore the potential of modern machine learning approaches in gene function prediction. This project will focus on leveraging protein sequences, language models and sequence embeddings to:

• Predict gene function using convolutional and transformer-based architectures

• Investigate the use of attention mechanisms to improve existing predictors

• Develop novel approaches for predicting protein–protein interactions using embedding space

• Optionally, prototype a variational autoencoder (VAE) to structure protein embedding space




You will work with state-of-the-art embedding models, gain hands-on experience with deep learning (CNNs, transformers, VAEs), and have room to tailor the project toward your interests in functional genomics or protein interaction networks.




Basic experience with Python and ML frameworks (e.g. PyTorch or TensorFlow) is a strong plus. Prior knowledge in bioinformatics is a plus, but not essential.




This opportunity is only given to students currently doing M.Sc. studies at the University of Copenhagen




Interested? Get in touch with Assoc. Prof. Marek Mutwil, PLEN, mutwil@plen.ku.dk

#Master #M.Sc #KU

Title: Full-stack Developer – customized code, AI and machine learning
Description:
Do you want a role as trusted advisor, where you will help our customers with a range of challenges focusing on delivering customized code tailored to each project? And are you passionate about working with AI and machine learning? Then you are the new colleague, we are looking for. This position is based at our office in Viby or in Nordhavn in Copenhagen with the flexibility to work from home.

Lead efficient and customized full-stack development solutions
You will be part of our Custom Software team, where we provide expert advice on software design and development. We help different customers in Denmark achieving digital transformation by analyzing business challenges and building custom software solutions to realize their visions.

As Full-stack Developer you will be responsible for designing and building complete software solutions ranging from setting up cloud infrastructure in Microsoft Azure; to developing robust, expressive, and well-tested backend code; as well as building accessible and flexible UIs. You will also have the opportunity to build AI-powered agents and applications.

Overall, your areas of responsibility will include:

Investigating customer needs to find the best fit software solution
Designing and architecting systems from front to back
Developing high-quality software that provides value to our customers
Monitoring and maintaining running software
Renovating legacy software to match new needs and challenges
Working with a range of technologies, languages, and frameworks to provide value across the whole stack
Working with AI to build powerful agents and tools to push our clients forward

Some of the skills we are interested in:

3+ years of experience in software development / full-stack development
A relevant bachelor’s or master’s degree within Computer Science or similar
Experience interacting with end customers
Experience with C# and .NET development
Experience working with web frontend frameworks and libraries such as Angular, React, HTMX and any others
Experience with cloud architecture and Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of or interest in project management
General good technical understanding and insight
Fluent in English – Danish is a plus but not a must

We understand that working with software involves an impossible number of technologies and frameworks to master, so don’t worry if you haven’t worked with every tool listed – we’d still love to hear from you!

Personal qualifications:

A skilled communicator: good at listening and building common understanding
A reasoned approach to decision making – you can consider the options available against the constraints of a task instead of just copy/pasting the same solution
Curiosity about how different parts of software fit together and how to build things from scratch
A knack for debugging and finding the causes of errors
Structured and diligent, you have the details covered
A team player, happy to work alongside your colleagues so we can build and improve together

What we can offer you:

Interesting and varied work: we have customers from many different industries that need software for different purposes
A hybrid workplace – a lot in the team work remotely for most of the week, but we group up when we want to run in person discussions or regularly on Fridays so we can keep regular contact with all our colleagues
Skilled and knowledgeable colleagues and the opportunity to learn and grow together
Opportunities for development: we want you to be the best you can be, and we attend conferences, run hackathons, maintain a solid library of professional literature and are always on the lookout for better ways that we can develop our skills
Social events, professional gatherings, and 1,700 amazing teamm8s as colleagues

Ready to be part of itm8?

We’re looking forward to receiving your CV.

If you have questions concerning the position, please feel free to contact Software Architect, Custom Software Adam Guest at phone +45 2493 9060 or e-mail adgue@itm8.com or TA Partner Trine Larsen at phone +45 2815 5806 or e-mail trlar@itm8.com.

All inquiries are treated confidentially. We hold ongoing interviews and complete the recruitment process when the right candidate is found. Furthermore, we obtain a criminal record prior to employment.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Show more

Title: Product Developer - American Football (Radar/DSP - Modelling - C++/Python)
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have an interest in American Football and Signal Processing? Do you want to develop tracking algorithms used by top athletes and in TV broadcasts all around the world?  Then come and join our American Football product team!

About The Job

We’re looking for a talented and motivated developer to join our team, working on innovative products within the American football space. This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of performance tracking and data-driven insights, with a particular focus on the development of tracking technology used by elite football players and football teams.

Our technology integrates vision tracking with radar tracking to deliver precise ball data measurements throughout its entire flight. In this role, you'll be a key part of our American Football Product Development, working across various domains such as signal processing, and modelling to build innovative solutions for performance analysis and optimization. From initial concept to final development, you’ll play a crucial part in enhancing our tracking solutions, applying your expertise to create real-world applications in American football technology.

As a member of the team, you will be part of a highly-skilled team focusing on the development and optimization of our state-of-the-art tracking algorithms used to measure ball and equipment kinematics across sports. Our products combine Doppler radars and cameras, where the Radar Tracking and Signal Processing team is responsible for converting raw radar signals into accurate and meaningful data on the performance of the athlete, where after the radar data is fused with information from video feeds and other sensors. This valuable information is subsequently made accessible on the user’s mobile device for easy-to-understand feedback and analysis on performance or is used in TV broadcasting for enhancing the viewing experience or in gamification. 

Our world-leading tracking technology is utilized across many sports such as soccer, golf and baseball, and you will specifically play a significant role in enhancing our American football product solution.

Requirements

What are we looking for?

Our ideal candidate is specialized in the following areas

Requirements:


Master’s degree or Ph.D. in computer science, electrical engineering, mathematical modelling, or equivalent
Knowledge of Digital Signal Processing (DSP)
Knowledge of data modeling


We are looking for a generalist with broad skills that include the requirements above. You should be passionate about applying your knowledge to solve real-world challenges and drive product development in an exciting and fast-paced industry.

Other relevant topics include:

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.


Software development and programming skills within C++ and Python
Strong mathematical skills
Optimization algorithms
Statistical signal processing
Software development experience
Strong communication skills
Machine learning
Interested in American football


Responsibilities

Implement tracking algorithms in close collaboration with our Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team and Modelling & Analysis team.

Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks.

Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments.

We expect that you can work independently as well as contribute in a fast-paced, innovative environment together with highly skilled colleagues. 

The Office

We offer a great office environment and facilities in our brand-new purpose-built Trackman Innovation Center, located at DTU Science Park in Hørsholm. We take great pride in the building we designed and built! The office features bright meeting rooms, coffee areas to catch up with colleagues, a large testing arena with simulators available for employees and a fitness center, everything surrounded by a beautiful forest and respecting the environment. We made sure to utilize the newest technologies to be energy efficient and be mindful of ventilation and sound propagation.

The cherry on top is our canteen: with indoor and outdoor areas to enjoy the fresh food prepared by our own kitchen staff.

Join the home of a powerful sports brand and a one-of-a-kind technology

Our proprietary technology is based on expert knowledge about radar, computer vision, data, and software engineering. Our solutions are developed by specialists who endlessly explore and challenge new technical boundaries. Trackman’s blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work. Our work culture is entrepreneurial, ambitious, and rewarding as you get to collaborate with inspiring colleagues and interact with the leaders of golf, baseball, and football. Based on a unique brand reputation, we are proud to work in close partnership with the top athletes, organizations, and teams that rely on our technology to stay ahead of the race. 

We are a Danish company founded, owned, and managed since 2003 by three entrepreneurs with a strong passion for sports. Today, we have a global footprint with our headquarters located in Denmark (Hørsholm) and offices in New York, Phoenix, Poland, and Tokyo. We employ over 800 people worldwide, half of which work in Denmark, where most hardware and software products are developed, tested, and manufactured.

Where innovation happens

At Trackman, we know that great people make great products. We believe that teams thrive, and innovation sparks in an atmosphere where people are encouraged to think for themselves, where everybody’s voices are heard, and where the best ideas prevail in the pursuit of exceptional solutions. This mix makes Trackman an inspiring company – for our customers and colleagues.

Share our Passion! 

Apply now

Title: AI Engineer - Denmark
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The life sciences industry plays a significant role in advancing healthcare and improving the quality of life - in many cases, saving millions of lives globally. At BASE life science, this is the motivation for everything we do, aimed at pushing boundaries, seeking excellence, and making a lasting difference through consulting expertise and data-driven solutions.




Who is BASE life science?

Founded in 2007, BASE life science is a business and technology consulting enterprise working exclusively in the life sciences industry.




From our headquarters in Denmark and offices in France, Germany, Italy, Spain, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, and the United States of America, we serve customers across the globe. With a deep understanding of the life sciences industry, we work hand in hand with customers to identify, develop, and implement strategic initiatives that drive growth, efficiency, and overall success through tailored solutions.




Our partnership with industry-leading solution providers, including Veeva, Salesforce, IQVIA, Benchling, and MediSpend ensures that our clients harness the full potential of the most innovative solutions on the market.




About the role

We are looking for AI Engineers excited about the power of large language models (LLMs) to help us transform the complex processes of the life science industry. You will work at the intersection of AI and life sciences to build smart, secure tools that streamline how our customers create, review, and manage critical documents—from clinical study protocols and reports to regulatory submissions and promotional materials.




You will be working with enterprise-grade LLMs (like OpenAI, Anthropic, and Cohere) through cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud. The focus is on applied AI — no need to build custom models from scratch. Instead, you will leverage and tune state-of-the-art language generation capabilities to solve real-world problems for medical writers, regulatory teams, and commercial functions.




We are looking to hire multiple people, and the seniority of the position will be based on your skill-set and professional experience.




As an AI Engineer your responsibilities include:

Design and deploy AI-powered tools that help teams draft, review, and analyse documents such as:
Clinical study protocols and clinical study reports (CSPs & CSRs) – and all of their associated documents.
Health Authority Q&A packages.
Medical, legal, and regulatory (MLR) content review.




Use enterprise LLMs to build features like summarization, document comparison, question answering, content classification, and redaction.
Develop pipelines using retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and integrate vector search to enhance context and relevance.
Ensure solutions are secure, auditable, and scalable in regulated cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
Work closely with regulatory, clinical, and commercial teams to understand their workflows and co-create AI tools that actually help.




We offer this position in Copenhagen, Denmark.




What makes you the best person for this job?

You enjoy building reliable AI tools that make complex work simpler—and more human.
You’re curious about how the life sciences industry works and want to make a tangible impact.
You’re excited about working in a highly cross-functional environment, collaborating with both technical and non-technical experts.
You learn fast, care about product/project delivery and quality, and thrive in a fast-evolving space.
You have strong communication skills in English.




On top of this, you have the following core competences:

Strong Python skills with experience in LLM orchestration libraries (e.g., LangChain, LlamaIndex, Haystack, Semantic Kernel), chain-of-thought, and structured reasoning approaches.
Hands-on experience with enterprise LLMs – their APIs, performance challenges, and how to mitigate those (OpenAI, Anthropic, Cohere, etc.)
Demonstrated production experience with APIs’ conventions and integration into pipelines, e.g. RESTful API, FastAPI, or similar.
Experience integrating multiple approaches for extracting highest-quality output from LLMs, e.g. prompt engineering, agentic- and graph-RAG, in-context learning (ICL), or NLP- or ontology-powered layering.
Proficiency with document processing pipelines (text extraction, chunking, embedding).
Strong foundation in data science fundamentals, including data analysis, statistical methods, and experience working with structured and unstructured data (preferably in healthcare or pharmaceutical contexts).
Experience with cloud services (AWS, GCP, or Azure).




It will be a plus if you have these additional capabilities:

Experience with semantic computing and document structuring, e.g. using MarkDown, LaTeX, or other taxonomic approaches.
Understanding of the pharmaceutical clinical and regulatory documents & workflows.
Proficiency with vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, Chroma, etc.) or SQL DB vector extensions (DuckDB vector similarity, SQLite VSS, pgvector, etc.).
Knowledge of ML ops practices for LLM-based systems.
Experience with containerization.
Specific experience and deploying secure, compliant apps through cloud services (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
Awareness of compliance and data handling standards (GxP, 21 CFR Part 11, HIPAA).




What makes us the best employer for you?

BASE life science has been recognized as an outstanding workplace, earning us the Great Place To Work certification in Spain, Germany, Switzerland, United States and the United Kingdom.




We are proud to represent 35+ nationalities among our colleagues, and firmly believe in the power of diverse perspectives and characteristics to drive truly innovative solutions and achieving excellence.




At the heart of our organization lies a foundation grounded in five core values: team spirit, trust, openness, ambition, and execution. We cultivate an environment that champions flexibility, placing confidence in our employees to successfully complete tasks while upholding a healthy work-life balance. Additionally, we place significance in cross-functional collaboration, where niche skills and specialisms are valued and challenging the status quo is encouraged.




Additionally, we offer you:

Health insurance.
Remote work friendliness.
Ongoing learning and development.
Flexible schedules to fit your work to your routine.
Contributions to physical, social, and emotional health.
Home office setup with laptop and other electronic devices.
The chance to help make a difference for patients around the world.




Interested?

If you find this position intriguing, don't delay—submit your application in English at your earliest convenience. We are continuously reviewing and assessing all incoming candidates and eagerly await your application.




By submitting your application, you consent to the processing of your personal data by BASE life science for the purposes of recruitment and selection. This includes the collection, storage, and use of your personal data as outlined in our Privacy Policy.

Show more
HTML:
The life sciences industry plays a significant role in advancing healthcare and improving the quality of life - in many cases, saving millions of lives globally. At BASE life science, this is the motivation for everything we do, aimed at pushing boundaries, seeking excellence, and making a lasting difference through consulting expertise and data-driven solutions.


Who is BASE life science?

Founded in 2007, BASE life science is a business and technology consulting enterprise working exclusively in the life sciences industry.


From our headquarters in Denmark and offices in France, Germany, Italy, Spain, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, and the United States of America, we serve customers across the globe. With a deep understanding of the life sciences industry, we work hand in hand with customers to identify, develop, and implement strategic initiatives that drive growth, efficiency, and overall success through tailored solutions.


Our partnership with industry-leading solution providers, including Veeva, Salesforce, IQVIA, Benchling, and MediSpend ensures that our clients harness the full potential of the most innovative solutions on the market.


About the role

We are looking for AI Engineers excited about the power of large language models (LLMs) to help us transform the complex processes of the life science industry. You will work at the intersection of AI and life sciences to build smart, secure tools that streamline how our customers create, review, and manage critical documents—from clinical study protocols and reports to regulatory submissions and promotional materials.


You will be working with enterprise-grade LLMs (like OpenAI, Anthropic, and Cohere) through cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud. The focus is on applied AI — no need to build custom models from scratch. Instead, you will leverage and tune state-of-the-art language generation capabilities to solve real-world problems for medical writers, regulatory teams, and commercial functions.


We are looking to hire multiple people, and the seniority of the position will be based on your skill-set and professional experience.


As an AI Engineer your responsibilities include:

  • Design and deploy AI-powered tools that help teams draft, review, and analyse documents such as:
  • Clinical study protocols and clinical study reports (CSPs & CSRs) – and all of their associated documents.
  • Health Authority Q&A packages.
  • Medical, legal, and regulatory (MLR) content review.


  • Use enterprise LLMs to build features like summarization, document comparison, question answering, content classification, and redaction.
  • Develop pipelines using retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and integrate vector search to enhance context and relevance.
  • Ensure solutions are secure, auditable, and scalable in regulated cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Work closely with regulatory, clinical, and commercial teams to understand their workflows and co-create AI tools that actually help.


We offer this position in Copenhagen, Denmark.


What makes you the best person for this job?

  • You enjoy building reliable AI tools that make complex work simpler—and more human.
  • You’re curious about how the life sciences industry works and want to make a tangible impact.
  • You’re excited about working in a highly cross-functional environment, collaborating with both technical and non-technical experts.
  • You learn fast, care about product/project delivery and quality, and thrive in a fast-evolving space.
  • You have strong communication skills in English.


On top of this, you have the following core competences:

  • Strong Python skills with experience in LLM orchestration libraries (e.g., LangChain, LlamaIndex, Haystack, Semantic Kernel), chain-of-thought, and structured reasoning approaches.
  • Hands-on experience with enterprise LLMs – their APIs, performance challenges, and how to mitigate those (OpenAI, Anthropic, Cohere, etc.)
  • Demonstrated production experience with APIs’ conventions and integration into pipelines, e.g. RESTful API, FastAPI, or similar.
  • Experience integrating multiple approaches for extracting highest-quality output from LLMs, e.g. prompt engineering, agentic- and graph-RAG, in-context learning (ICL), or NLP- or ontology-powered layering.
  • Proficiency with document processing pipelines (text extraction, chunking, embedding).
  • Strong foundation in data science fundamentals, including data analysis, statistical methods, and experience working with structured and unstructured data (preferably in healthcare or pharmaceutical contexts).
  • Experience with cloud services (AWS, GCP, or Azure).


It will be a plus if you have these additional capabilities:

  • Experience with semantic computing and document structuring, e.g. using MarkDown, LaTeX, or other taxonomic approaches.
  • Understanding of the pharmaceutical clinical and regulatory documents & workflows.
  • Proficiency with vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, Chroma, etc.) or SQL DB vector extensions (DuckDB vector similarity, SQLite VSS, pgvector, etc.).
  • Knowledge of ML ops practices for LLM-based systems.
  • Experience with containerization.
  • Specific experience and deploying secure, compliant apps through cloud services (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
  • Awareness of compliance and data handling standards (GxP, 21 CFR Part 11, HIPAA).


What makes us the best employer for you?

BASE life science has been recognized as an outstanding workplace, earning us the Great Place To Work certification in Spain, Germany, Switzerland, United States and the United Kingdom.


We are proud to represent 35+ nationalities among our colleagues, and firmly believe in the power of diverse perspectives and characteristics to drive truly innovative solutions and achieving excellence.


At the heart of our organization lies a foundation grounded in five core values: team spirit, trust, openness, ambition, and execution. We cultivate an environment that champions flexibility, placing confidence in our employees to successfully complete tasks while upholding a healthy work-life balance. Additionally, we place significance in cross-functional collaboration, where niche skills and specialisms are valued and challenging the status quo is encouraged.


Additionally, we offer you:

  • Health insurance.
  • Remote work friendliness.
  • Ongoing learning and development.
  • Flexible schedules to fit your work to your routine.
  • Contributions to physical, social, and emotional health.
  • Home office setup with laptop and other electronic devices.
  • The chance to help make a difference for patients around the world.


Interested?

If you find this position intriguing, don't delay—submit your application in English at your earliest convenience. We are continuously reviewing and assessing all incoming candidates and eagerly await your application.


By submitting your application, you consent to the processing of your personal data by BASE life science for the purposes of recruitment and selection. This includes the collection, storage, and use of your personal data as outlined in our Privacy Policy.

Title: Graduate Program - Innovation Impact -R&D Data Scientist Chemistry (d/f/m)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About the Innovation Impact Program Our 18-month Graduate Program starts on October 1st, 2025, at our Henkel Adhesive Technologies Innovation Center in Düsseldorf. You will be part of an exciting development journey, where you will receive a permanent contract from day one, relocation support, and hands-on experience across various innovative technologies. Upon completion, you will have the opportunity to transition into global roles within Henkel’s innovation network.

What You´ll Do


Partner with product developers and application engineers as part of our R&D team in Düsseldorf, Germany to understand technologies, data collection processes, and challenges driving the digital transformation within R&D
Design and conduct data analysis projects to identify trends and patterns in formulation data sets, and build and deploy machine learning models to predict formulation performance, stability, and quality
Collaborate closely with R&D colleagues to translate data insights into new formulations, product development decisions, and application processes - optimizing R&D workflows
Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards to effectively communicate insights to technical and business stakeholders
Leverage your digital skillset to drive awareness and application of data-based decision-making and digital tools across R&D
Support the digital transformation of R&D by implementing data-driven workflows for process development and knowledge management


What makes you a good fit


You have recently completed, or are about to complete, a Master’s or Ph.D. that combines a strong foundation in Chemistry, Engineering, or Materials Science with Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, or a related analytical field—for example, a Bachelor’s in a natural science and a digitally focused Master's, or interdisciplinary studies that enable you to understand both lab-based R&D and data-driven approaches
You bring first hands-on experience with data analysis and modeling in scientific or engineering contexts, and have a strong grasp of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms (e.g., regression, classification)
You are proficient in data tools such as Python or R, DoE software like Minitab or JMP, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau); experience with IoT, finite element analysis (FEA), and computational fluid dynamics (CFD) is a plus
You are interested in working in a laboratory environment, motivated to learn about formulations, product development, and R&D workflows, and keen to apply your skills in a hands-on setting
You enjoy collaborating with non-digital colleagues, and can confidently explain digital tools and data concepts in a simple, practical way to support their daily work
You are interested in growing your career in Henkel’s global Innovation network, with relocation as one possible path after the program.
Proficiency in English is essential, as you will work in an international environment


Ready to take the next step in your career? Visit our program landing page for full details and apply today.

Some perks of joining Henkel

At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, generations and disabilities. If there are any specific accommodations or adjustments you require for the interview process or your on-site appointment, please inform us, and we'll do our best to accommodate your requests.

Title: Life Science Software/Data Engineer
Description:
Job Summary

IFF Campus Brabrand is an innovation powerhouse in food, feed, and health, and we are part of a global network of 10 R&D sites and 16 application sites. Our R&D teams are at the forefront of innovation, dedicated to helping our customers succeed with high-performing nature-powered products.

In health and biosciences, we have multiple R&D teams, and they are streamlining and automating our workflows for an end-to-end data-driven R&D process.

We are looking for a Life Science Software/Data Engineer to help drive and accelerate our efforts. If you are passionate about innovation and ready to make a significant impact, we hope it’s you!

Who we are

IFF is a global leader in food, feed, beverage, health, and biosciences. We merge science and creativity to create essential solutions for a better world.

At IFF Campus Brabrand, we have 250+ top-notch scientific and innovation staff supporting all IFF businesses and 130,000 sq ft of R&D & innovation lab space. Our competencies span immunology and fermentation, as well as ingredient science and application, supported by advanced chemical and physical analysis, and data analytics. This enables us to understand processes and mechanisms down to the molecular or cellular level.

Our facilities enable experimentation from microscopic scales to pilot plant testing, all under one roof. In collaboration with colleagues, collaboration partners, and customers worldwide, we shape the future of food, feed, and health.

The position

We are seeking an experienced engineer who excels at the intersection of software development, lab automation, and scientific domains, primarily within biology and chemistry. You will develop software to automate processes and ensure data is structured and accessible.

As our Life Science Software/Data Engineer, you will help create the stack that implements our domain logic and how it communicates with storage backends and instruments. You will identify preferred 3rd party technologies and decide on components to develop internally.

We offer


A job in a global team with opportunities for collaboration across functions in Brabrand and globally
The opportunity to work on global projects that drive competitive advantage for the business
The opportunity to work with top-notch skilled scientists and experts within a broad range of scientific domains in Brabrand
A role with plenty of opportunities for professional and personal growth; training, and mentoring
An engaging work environment created by an inclusive and multicultural team


Responsibilities And Tasks


Create software solutions to integrate our Laboratory Information Management System (Benchling) seamlessly with other systems
Design data models to support experimental protocols
Build, implement, and maintain scripts and applications to support operations
Develop, update, and maintain data repositories using open data formats, (e.g., mass spectrometry data, .mzML, MS image data, .imzML, or spectral libraries
Containerize applications to ensure pipelines are accessible and consistent across IFF
Identify and onboard third-party services and tools to offload non-core tasks
Assist in the development and enhancement of imaging tools
Establish standards for colleagues to ensure consistent practices and provide training and documentation


Qualifications

Required:


A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or related technical field
Passion for and documented experience writing high-quality, structured, and maintainable code
Proficiency in procedural programming language(s) (Python preferred)
Experience with version control systems (Git /GitLab)
Familiarity with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Singularity)
Familiarity with AWS cloud services (e.g., S3, Lambda, Glue)
Proficiency with SQL (Postgres, SQL Server) databases
Proficiency with Linux


Preferred:


Experience with experimental science (Biology preferred)
Experience with various instrument-generated bioanalytical and physical data types, such as mass spectrometry, rheometry, imaging, and spectroscopy data.
Experience with DevOps and MLOps
Experience with NoSQL databases
Proven ability to build scalable solutions
Experience deploying AI/machine learning models utilizing GPU acceleration
Experience with GPU programming (e.g., CUDA, Open CL)
Familiarity with meta-data modeling techniques to organize experimental data
Knowledge of data visualization and statistics


We emphasize achieving goals through collaborative efforts. It is essential that you leverage your strong interpersonal and communication skills to work effectively with others and achieve results as a team.

Fluency in spoken and written English is required.

We are a global leader in taste, scent, and nutrition, offering our customers a broader range of natural solutions and accelerating our growth strategy. At IFF, we believe that your uniqueness unleashes our potential. We value the diverse mosaic of the ethnicity, national origin, race, age, sex, or veteran status. We strive for an inclusive workplace that allows each of our colleagues to bring their authentic self to work regardless of their religion, gender identity & expression, sexual orientation, or disability.

Visit IFF.com/careers/workplace-diversity-and-inclusion to learn more
Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Who We Are

Zeta Global (NYSE: ZETA) is the AI-Powered Marketing Cloud that leverages advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and trillions of consumer signals to make it easier for marketers to acquire, grow, and retain customers more efficiently. Through the Zeta Marketing Platform (ZMP), our vision is to make sophisticated marketing simple by unifying identity, intelligence, and omnichannel activation into a single platform – powered by one of the industry’s largest proprietary databases and AI. Our enterprise customers across multiple verticals are empowered to personalize experiences with consumers at an individual level across every channel, delivering better results for marketing programs. Zeta was founded in 2007 by David A. Steinberg and John Sculley and is headquartered in New York City with offices around the world. To learn more, go to www.zetaglobal.com.

THE ROLE

Zeta Global is seeking a talented and versatile Machine Learning Engineer to join our newly formed Exchange team within our highly skilled development office in Copenhagen. This team plays a critical role in developing and deploying Zeta’s next-generation data science and engineering technology, collaborating closely with our global teams in New York, Berlin, and Prague. The Copenhagen office boasts a dynamic and focused environment, comprising a core group of start-up veterans and approximately 30 highly skilled professionals.

As a member of the Exchange team, you will contribute to the analysis, development and maintenance of our complex AI-powered ad-exchange platform, a sophisticated ecosystem of interconnected systems. This newly established team will tackle a continuous stream of challenging projects originating from across the organization, demanding a high degree of expertise and innovation. We are seeking candidates with a strong foundation in data science, machine learning engineering, and data analysis, and a demonstrated interest in exploring the intersections between these disciplines. As we are building production machine learning systems, experience or interest in software development principles, data engineering, and MLOps practices are highly desirable.

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate for the Machine Learning Engineer position at Zeta Global Copenhagen is a highly motivated and analytical individual with a passion for understanding complex systems. You are adept at using data to identify issues, formulate solutions, and develop robust algorithms and software. You thrive in an environment that offers significant autonomy in planning and executing your work, yet you are also a strong collaborator, readily engaging with fellow developers and international product stakeholders.

You will be involved in every stage of the development process, from initial brainstorming to ongoing maintenance, with a primary emphasis on analysis, prototyping, and development. Our development process is a dynamic blend of agile and rapid prototyping methodologies, designed to foster a culture of "flexibility under responsibility." We prioritize focused development time and believe in the power of collaborative problem-solving, encouraging team members to both seek and offer assistance readily.

Requirements

We welcome candidates with a solid background in data analysis or software development, seeking professionals with proven experience rather than recent graduates. Regardless of your background, a crucial element is your intellectual curiosity, self-motivation, and a demonstrable ability to translate real-world challenges into mathematical models, statistical analyses, algorithms, and ultimately, functional code. A strong interest in machine learning and/or the adtech domain, along with its associated technologies, is highly desirable, as well as knowledge of object-oriented programming languages, particularly Scala.


A strong academic background in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or related disciplines).
Experience in developing and deploying machine learning models in production.
Proficiency in Python or Scala for machine learning and data processing.
Strong data analysis and feature engineering skills.
Experience with MLOps and building scalable ML pipelines.


Desired Qualifications


Demonstrated experience with Scala or Python for production-ready ML applications.
Software engineering experience, including best practices for code optimization and maintainability.
Knowledge of distributed computing frameworks like Spark for large-scale data processing.
Experience with model optimization techniques and hyperparameter tuning.
Familiarity with auction mechanisms and real-time bidding models.
Experience in market segmentation and audience targeting.
Experience using Airflow for ML pipeline orchestration.
AWS cloud expertise, including SageMaker and other ML-related services.


You approach problems with an analytical mindset and a pragmatic approach to solution development. You are a creative thinker, capable of identifying opportunities and weaknesses in proposed solutions, and constructively contributing your own ideas. You thrive in a dynamic environment, adept at juggling multiple projects and connecting them with underlying data. You recognize that exploring new facets of data often yields greater insights than fine-tuning algorithmic parameters. You are equally comfortable implementing and optimizing solutions, and you are eager to tackle new challenges.

What We Offer

Join our dynamic team, largely comprised of Masters and PhDs in fields like Physics, Math, and Computer Science, and play a key role in shaping the future of our technology. You will collaborate with highly skilled professionals in a stimulating environment that fosters both learning and individual initiative. While we are passionate about exploring cutting-edge technologies and algorithms, we maintain a practical approach to implementing solutions.

We believe in empowering our employees with autonomy and flexibility. We offer flexible work arrangements, including adjustable office hours and the possibility of occasional remote work, provided commitments are consistently fulfilled. You will have the freedom to select your preferred operating system (Linux, Mac, Windows) and development tools, with the expectation of independent maintenance and troubleshooting. We encourage the introduction of new technologies, contingent upon demonstrating their value and gaining team buy-in.

Our international presence provides ample opportunities for cross-departmental collaboration and potential career advancement in locations like Berlin, San Francisco or New York. This full-time position (37 hours per week) is based at our Copenhagen office, located at Bernstorffsgade 21. A competitive benefits package is provided, including lunch, telephone/internet, and health insurance. The ideal candidate will be available to start as soon as possible.

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply via LinkedIn, submitting a cover letter along with their application. Interviews will be scheduled on a continuous basis.

This is a hybrid role based out of Copenhagen.

PEOPLE & CULTURE AT ZETA

Zeta considers applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s sex, race, color, religion, age, disability, status as a veteran, or national or ethnic origin; nor does Zeta discriminate on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.

We’re committed to building a workplace culture of trust and belonging, so everyone feels invited to bring their whole selves to work. We provide a forum for employees to celebrate, support and advocate for one another. Learn more about our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion here: https://zetaglobal.com/blog/a-look-into-zetas-ergs/

ZETA IN THE NEWS!

https://zetaglobal.com/press/?cat=press-releases


Show more

Our development process is a dynamic blend of agile and rapid prototyping methodologies, designed to foster a culture of "flexibility under responsibility." We prioritize focused development time and believe in the power of collaborative problem-solving, encouraging team members to both seek and offer assistance readily.

Requirements

We welcome candidates with a solid background in data analysis or software development, seeking professionals with proven experience rather than recent graduates. Regardless of your background, a crucial element is your intellectual curiosity, self-motivation, and a demonstrable ability to translate real-world challenges into mathematical models, statistical analyses, algorithms, and ultimately, functional code. A strong interest in machine learning and/or the adtech domain, along with its associated technologies, is highly desirable, as well as knowledge of object-oriented programming languages, particularly Scala.

  • A strong academic background in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or related disciplines).
  • Experience in developing and deploying machine learning models in production.
  • Proficiency in Python or Scala for machine learning and data processing.
  • Strong data analysis and feature engineering skills.
  • Experience with MLOps and building scalable ML pipelines.

Desired Qualifications

  • Demonstrated experience with Scala or Python for production-ready ML applications.
  • Software engineering experience, including best practices for code optimization and maintainability.
  • Knowledge of distributed computing frameworks like Spark for large-scale data processing.
  • Experience with model optimization techniques and hyperparameter tuning.
  • Familiarity with auction mechanisms and real-time bidding models.
  • Experience in market segmentation and audience targeting.
  • Experience using Airflow for ML pipeline orchestration.
  • AWS cloud expertise, including SageMaker and other ML-related services.

You approach problems with an analytical mindset and a pragmatic approach to solution development. You are a creative thinker, capable of identifying opportunities and weaknesses in proposed solutions, and constructively contributing your own ideas. You thrive in a dynamic environment, adept at juggling multiple projects and connecting them with underlying data. You recognize that exploring new facets of data often yields greater insights than fine-tuning algorithmic parameters. You are equally comfortable implementing and optimizing solutions, and you are eager to tackle new challenges.

What We Offer

Join our dynamic team, largely comprised of Masters and PhDs in fields like Physics, Math, and Computer Science, and play a key role in shaping the future of our technology. You will collaborate with highly skilled professionals in a stimulating environment that fosters both learning and individual initiative. While we are passionate about exploring cutting-edge technologies and algorithms, we maintain a practical approach to implementing solutions.

We believe in empowering our employees with autonomy and flexibility. We offer flexible work arrangements, including adjustable office hours and the possibility of occasional remote work, provided commitments are consistently fulfilled. You will have the freedom to select your preferred operating system (Linux, Mac, Windows) and development tools, with the expectation of independent maintenance and troubleshooting. We encourage the introduction of new technologies, contingent upon demonstrating their value and gaining team buy-in.

Our international presence provides ample opportunities for cross-departmental collaboration and potential career advancement in locations like Berlin, San Francisco or New York. This full-time position (37 hours per week) is based at our Copenhagen office, located at Bernstorffsgade 21. A competitive benefits package is provided, including lunch, telephone/internet, and health insurance. The ideal candidate will be available to start as soon as possible.

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply via LinkedIn, submitting a cover letter along with their application. Interviews will be scheduled on a continuous basis.

This is a hybrid role based out of Copenhagen.

PEOPLE & CULTURE AT ZETA

Zeta considers applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s sex, race, color, religion, age, disability, status as a veteran, or national or ethnic origin; nor does Zeta discriminate on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.

We’re committed to building a workplace culture of trust and belonging, so everyone feels invited to bring their whole selves to work. We provide a forum for employees to celebrate, support and advocate for one another. Learn more about our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion here: https://zetaglobal.com/blog/a-look-into-zetas-ergs/

ZETA IN THE NEWS!

https://zetaglobal.com/press/?cat=press-releases

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Help the world's most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

You must write Danish for this specific AI training opportunity

About The Opportunity


We are looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by...


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples of desirable expertise:


Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Danish (required)
Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment:


Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.
