Title: Full-stack Developer – customized code, AI and machine learning
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want a role as trusted advisor, where you will help our customers with a range of challenges focusing on delivering customized code tailored to each project? And are you passionate about working with AI and machine learning? Then you are the new colleague, we are looking for. This position is based at our office in Viby or in Nordhavn in Copenhagen with the flexibility to work from home.

Lead efficient and customized full-stack development solutions
You will be part of our Custom Software team, where we provide expert advice on software design and development. We help different customers in Denmark achieving digital transformation by analyzing business challenges and building custom software solutions to realize their visions.

As Full-stack Developer you will be responsible for designing and building complete software solutions ranging from setting up cloud infrastructure in Microsoft Azure; to developing robust, expressive, and well-tested backend code; as well as building accessible and flexible UIs. You will also have the opportunity to build AI-powered agents and applications.

Overall, your areas of responsibility will include:

Investigating customer needs to find the best fit software solution
Designing and architecting systems from front to back
Developing high-quality software that provides value to our customers
Monitoring and maintaining running software
Renovating legacy software to match new needs and challenges
Working with a range of technologies, languages, and frameworks to provide value across the whole stack
Working with AI to build powerful agents and tools to push our clients forward

Some of the skills we are interested in:

3+ years of experience in software development / full-stack development
A relevant bachelor’s or master’s degree within Computer Science or similar
Experience interacting with end customers
Experience with C# and .NET development
Experience working with web frontend frameworks and libraries such as Angular, React, HTMX and any others
Experience with cloud architecture and Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of or interest in project management
General good technical understanding and insight
Fluent in English – Danish is a plus but not a must

We understand that working with software involves an impossible number of technologies and frameworks to master, so don’t worry if you haven’t worked with every tool listed – we’d still love to hear from you!

Personal qualifications:

A skilled communicator: good at listening and building common understanding
A reasoned approach to decision making – you can consider the options available against the constraints of a task instead of just copy/pasting the same solution
Curiosity about how different parts of software fit together and how to build things from scratch
A knack for debugging and finding the causes of errors
Structured and diligent, you have the details covered
A team player, happy to work alongside your colleagues so we can build and improve together

What we can offer you:

Interesting and varied work: we have customers from many different industries that need software for different purposes
A hybrid workplace – a lot in the team work remotely for most of the week, but we group up when we want to run in person discussions or regularly on Fridays so we can keep regular contact with all our colleagues
Skilled and knowledgeable colleagues and the opportunity to learn and grow together
Opportunities for development: we want you to be the best you can be, and we attend conferences, run hackathons, maintain a solid library of professional literature and are always on the lookout for better ways that we can develop our skills
Social events, professional gatherings, and 1,700 amazing teamm8s as colleagues

Ready to be part of itm8?

We’re looking forward to receiving your CV.

If you have questions concerning the position, please feel free to contact Software Architect, Custom Software Adam Guest at phone +45 2493 9060 or e-mail adgue@itm8.com or TA Partner Trine Larsen at phone +45 2815 5806 or e-mail trlar@itm8.com.

All inquiries are treated confidentially. We hold ongoing interviews and complete the recruitment process when the right candidate is found. Furthermore, we obtain a criminal record prior to employment.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Application Engineer
Description:
Application Engineer søges til Nordcad




Er du vores nye kollega?




Vi søger en Application Engineer, som skal fungere som vores kunders foretrukne sparringspartner. Du skal derfor trives med både kundekontakt, og teknisk og kompleks udvikling af elektronik systemer. Er du utålmodig og måldrevet af natur? Er du nysgerrig, og har du altid haft teknisk flair? Kan du lide at præsentere og rådgive?




Så skal du læse videre!

Timer: Fuldtid

Tiltrædelse: August (vi starter screeninger allerede nu, og afholder løbende samtaler)

Arbejdssted: Aalborg







Hvis du kan genkende dette, så er det dig vi leder efter!

Du er utrolig måldrevet. Du elsker et klart mål og en klar retning, og der findes nærmest ingen bedre følelse end at nå de mål, du har sat dig. Du elsker at føle dig effektiv, og at udrette noget.
Du er utålmodig af natur. Du får et stort energiboost, når du får lov til at igangsætte ting. Du er heller ikke bange for det uventede, og du har næsten altid været god til at håndtere det uforudsete.
Når du har lavet en aftale, tager du 100% ansvar for den. Du føler nærmest et psykologisk ejerskab over dine forpligtelser, da du ikke kan lide uforløste ting på dit bord.
Du drives af at få et smil frem hos andre, og du bærer det altid rundt selv. Du bruger måske humor, eller har let til smil, og du har meget nemt ved at finde de positive vinkler på ting.
Du er motiveret af uforudsigelighed og udfordringer, og så er du også ret kreativ af natur. Når andre står med problemer, så finder du forløsning og motivation ved at hjælpe dem med at fikse tingene. Du er motiveret af kompleksitet.
Du kan hurtigt forholde dig til ny viden, og hvad den betyder. Du er nysgerrig, og hurtig til at lære nyt og sætte det i brug bagefter. Du finder det generelt stimulerende at lære nyt.
Du er selvsikker i dine tanker og beslutninger, og når du formidler, lytter andre. Du er overbevisende og troværdig, da du har styr på dine ting, og ved hvad du snakker om.







Dine ansvarsområder vil være:

Hjælpe kunder godt i gang med diverse tools og systemer.
Lave analysearbejde for kunderne, og hjælpe med at skræddersy forskellige løsninger.
Udvikle nye produkter med teamet og kunderne.
Udarbejde og fremvise produktpræsentationer og tekniske demoer i Norden.
Udarbejde og afholde webinarer.
Generelt at besøge kunder og identificere tekniske behov, for at starte nye projekter op og hjælpe kunderne godt i gang.







Hvad vi forventer af dig:

Flydende dansk & engelsk. Du føler dig komfortabel med samtaler på dansk/norsk/svensk.
Du har som minimum en bacheloruddannelse indenfor elektronik. Det er en fordel at have arbejdet med simulering, og du har praktisk erfaring med elektronik design.
Du har gerne taget en længerevarende uddannelse inden for elektronik, og du skal helst have arbejdet med elektronik udvikling i nogle år. Kunderne skal kunne mærke trygheden i, at du har stået med tingene i hænderne selv, og du derfor ved hvad du snakker om.
Du har lyst til at rejse i de nordiske lande (30-50 dage om året), og du kan selv stille bil til rådighed.







Om Nordcad og teamkulturen

Nordcad er en førende leverandør af software til elektronik industrien i Norden.

Vi har eksisteret siden 1987, og har i dag også selskaber i Norge, Sverige og Finland. Vi sælger software for Cadence, som er en af verdens førende software producenter. Vi er i øjeblikket 20 medarbejdere, der arbejder på at hjælpe blandt andet elektronikindustrien med at være forrest på teknologi.




Vi er en stærk partner til vores kunder, fordi vi går meget op i at levere den nyeste knowhow, og så kan vi rigtig godt lide at rådgive vores kunder. Vi skal være deres Go-To, altid.




Vores kultur bærer præg af ’Frihed under ansvar’ – og hvad mener vi så med det?

Vi ansætter folk som vi stoler på, kan deres kram. Og det man ikke kan på forhånd, det lærer vi dem. Vi går ind for autonomi, og for at skabe en hverdag hvor man trives under det ansvar man har. Når man får energi af at løse sine opgaver, så oplever vi at medarbejderne naturligt tager mere medansvar, og at kvaliteten altid er høj.




Kulturen hos os er en god blanding af en morgenhilsen ved kaffemaskinen, og et fælles drive om at levere service fra den øverste skuffe. Vi er både sociale og hårdtarbejdende, fordi vi mener man godt kan have det sjovt, imens man leverer 100%.







Hvad vi tilbyder

Et arbejdsmiljø hvor vi forsøger at forstå dig, på en sådan måde, at vi kan spille dig bedst muligt god ift. opgaver, ledelsesstil og teamkultur
Mulighed for at blive en del af den danske afdeling i en international koncern
Sociale arrangementer hver måned







Test i rekrutteringsprocessen

I rekrutteringsprocessen bruger vi talenttest. Du vil derfor i løbet af processen modtage et link til testen.

I testen handler det ikke om at svare rigtigt eller forkert, men om at afdække hvorvidt din naturlige adfærd og styrker matcher den kontekst du skal arbejde i.

Kan du genkende dig selv i opslaget? Så ser vi frem til at høre fra dig!







Spørgsmål

Har du nogle spørgsmål, så kontakt venligst:




Rasmus Schelde-Bollin

Recruitment & Talent Specialist

TalentX

Tlf: 4073 4627

Mail: rasmus@talentx.dk

Show more

Title: Agentic AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Shape the Future of AI-Driven Autonomy with VML MAP Agentic Labs

Are you passionate about pushing the boundaries of AI technology? Do you want to build next-generation agentic AI systems that go beyond traditional automation and redefine human+AI collaboration? If so, join our Agentic AI Lab, where you'll work at the cutting edge of multi-agent architectures, autonomous workflows, and AI reasoning systems.

About VML MAP Agentic Labs

At VML MAP, we are investing in the future by leading the way in agentic AI development. Over the past year, we’ve built VML MAP Agentic Labs, a four-pronged initiative focused on designing, building, and implementing agentic AI solutions that drive real business value for ourselves and our clients. Our labs include:

Agentic Design Lab – A product centric function responsible for uncovering and designing value-driven agentic AI opportunities that are feasible, viable, and deliverable.

Agentic Development Lab – A best-in-class agentic platform and development practice, delivering multi-agent workflows with rapid, outcome-driven iterations and long-term adoption strategies.

Agentic Research Lab – Focused on agentic architecture, human+AI workflows and enabling fast, well-founded development decisions with deep methodology research.

Agentic Tooling Lab – Ensuring market-ready AI and agentic solutions are optimized for adoption and effectiveness instead of reinventing existing tools.

As an Agentic AI Engineer, you will directly contribute to this initiative, working alongside AI researchers, engineers, and business stakeholders to create scalable and impactful AI solutions.

What will your day look like?

Responsibilities

As part of the Agentic AI Lab, you’ll be at the forefront of designing, developing, and optimizing intelligent multi-agent systems that tackle complex, real-world challenges. Your responsibilities will include:


Designing, developing and deploying multi-agent AI systems
Building and optimizing agentic workflows for real-world applications that enhance decision-making and operational efficiency.
Collaborating across teams—from AI engineers to business architects—to conceptualize and implement cutting-edge AI solutions.
Refining agentic reasoning steps, process logging, and system performance to ensure robust, explainable, and scalable agent behaviour.
Architecting and deploying agentic AI solutions while ensuring scalability, reliability, and ethical considerations.
Contributing to the strategic direction of the Agentic AI Lab by identifying new opportunities for agentic applications.
Defining and documenting design processes, system architectures, and best practices for knowledge-sharing and future development.
Staying up to date with the latest advancements in agentic AI and incorporate cutting-edge techniques into development workflows.


What do you bring to the table?

We’re Looking For Someone Who’s Both Highly Technical And Deeply Curious, With a Passion For Exploring The Frontiers Of AI Autonomy. You Should Have


Strong expertise in agentic AI and foundation models, ideally with experience developing and testing multi-agent systems.
Experience and learnings using agentic frameworks such as LangGraph, CrewAI, SmolAgents, and AutoGen.
Hands-on experience deploying AI/ML systems in production, preferably agentic/multi-agent settings.
Proficiency in programming languages, such as Python (Must), Java (or similar languages), with a focus in AI/ML frameworks.
Deep understanding of agentic AI concepts, including reasoning processes, process logging, optimisation, reinforcement learning, autonomous systems, and distributed AI.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) for scalable deployments.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and GitOps for automated build, test, and deployment workflows.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to translate complex requirements into practical solutions.
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in interdisciplinary teams.


It Is a Plus If You Have Experience With


Publications or open-source contributions in agentic AI, multi-agent systems, or autonomous AI.
Understanding ethical considerations and best practices in deploying AI systems.


Why Join Us?


Work at the cutting edge of agentic AI—beyond chatbots, we’re building real-world AI-driven autonomy.
Be part of a dynamic and innovative team at the forefront of AI research and development.
Be part of a physical lab in CPH – we're looking for folks to be based on the ground in Copenhagen, based in our impressive office space, with a hybrid/in-office policy.
Make an impact—your work will directly shape the future of AI-driven collaboration and automation.
Grow your expertise in one of AI’s fastest-growing fields, with opportunities for professional development.
Competitive salary and benefits in a forward-thinking and supportive environment.


Join us in defining the next era of intelligent AI agents!

WPP (VML MAP) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML MAP on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn and X.

When you click “Apply now” below, your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data during when you apply for a role with us, on how you can update your information or have the information removed please read our Privacy policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice.

HTML:
Shape the Future of AI-Driven Autonomy with VML MAP Agentic Labs

Are you passionate about pushing the boundaries of AI technology? Do you want to build next-generation agentic AI systems that go beyond traditional automation and redefine human+AI collaboration? If so, join our Agentic AI Lab, where you'll work at the cutting edge of multi-agent architectures, autonomous workflows, and AI reasoning systems.

About VML MAP Agentic Labs

At VML MAP, we are investing in the future by leading the way in agentic AI development. Over the past year, we’ve built VML MAP Agentic Labs, a four-pronged initiative focused on designing, building, and implementing agentic AI solutions that drive real business value for ourselves and our clients. Our labs include:

Agentic Design Lab – A product centric function responsible for uncovering and designing value-driven agentic AI opportunities that are feasible, viable, and deliverable.

Agentic Development Lab – A best-in-class agentic platform and development practice, delivering multi-agent workflows with rapid, outcome-driven iterations and long-term adoption strategies.

Agentic Research Lab – Focused on agentic architecture, human+AI workflows and enabling fast, well-founded development decisions with deep methodology research.

Agentic Tooling Lab – Ensuring market-ready AI and agentic solutions are optimized for adoption and effectiveness instead of reinventing existing tools.

As an Agentic AI Engineer, you will directly contribute to this initiative, working alongside AI researchers, engineers, and business stakeholders to create scalable and impactful AI solutions.

What will your day look like?

Responsibilities

As part of the Agentic AI Lab, you’ll be at the forefront of designing, developing, and optimizing intelligent multi-agent systems that tackle complex, real-world challenges. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Designing, developing and deploying multi-agent AI systems
  • Building and optimizing agentic workflows for real-world applications that enhance decision-making and operational efficiency.
  • Collaborating across teams—from AI engineers to business architects—to conceptualize and implement cutting-edge AI solutions.
  • Refining agentic reasoning steps, process logging, and system performance to ensure robust, explainable, and scalable agent behaviour.
  • Architecting and deploying agentic AI solutions while ensuring scalability, reliability, and ethical considerations.
  • Contributing to the strategic direction of the Agentic AI Lab by identifying new opportunities for agentic applications.
  • Defining and documenting design processes, system architectures, and best practices for knowledge-sharing and future development.
  • Staying up to date with the latest advancements in agentic AI and incorporate cutting-edge techniques into development workflows.

What do you bring to the table?

We’re Looking For Someone Who’s Both Highly Technical And Deeply Curious, With a Passion For Exploring The Frontiers Of AI Autonomy. You Should Have

  • Strong expertise in agentic AI and foundation models, ideally with experience developing and testing multi-agent systems.
  • Experience and learnings using agentic frameworks such as LangGraph, CrewAI, SmolAgents, and AutoGen.
  • Hands-on experience deploying AI/ML systems in production, preferably agentic/multi-agent settings.
  • Proficiency in programming languages, such as Python (Must), Java (or similar languages), with a focus in AI/ML frameworks.
  • Deep understanding of agentic AI concepts, including reasoning processes, process logging, optimisation, reinforcement learning, autonomous systems, and distributed AI.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) for scalable deployments.
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines and GitOps for automated build, test, and deployment workflows.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to translate complex requirements into practical solutions.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in interdisciplinary teams.

It Is a Plus If You Have Experience With

  • Publications or open-source contributions in agentic AI, multi-agent systems, or autonomous AI.
  • Understanding ethical considerations and best practices in deploying AI systems.

Why Join Us?

  • Work at the cutting edge of agentic AI—beyond chatbots, we’re building real-world AI-driven autonomy.
  • Be part of a dynamic and innovative team at the forefront of AI research and development.
  • Be part of a physical lab in CPH – we're looking for folks to be based on the ground in Copenhagen, based in our impressive office space, with a hybrid/in-office policy.
  • Make an impact—your work will directly shape the future of AI-driven collaboration and automation.
  • Grow your expertise in one of AI’s fastest-growing fields, with opportunities for professional development.
  • Competitive salary and benefits in a forward-thinking and supportive environment.

Join us in defining the next era of intelligent AI agents!

WPP (VML MAP) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML MAP on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn and X.

Title: M.Sc project in Artificial Intelligence Researcher
Company: Department of Plant and Environmental Sciences, University of Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Master’s Thesis Project Opportunity: Artificial Intelligence used for Protein Function & Interaction Prediction




We are looking for a motivated Master’s student to explore the potential of modern machine learning approaches in gene function prediction. This project will focus on leveraging protein sequences, language models and sequence embeddings to:

• Predict gene function using convolutional and transformer-based architectures

• Investigate the use of attention mechanisms to improve existing predictors

• Develop novel approaches for predicting protein–protein interactions using embedding space

• Optionally, prototype a variational autoencoder (VAE) to structure protein embedding space




You will work with state-of-the-art embedding models, gain hands-on experience with deep learning (CNNs, transformers, VAEs), and have room to tailor the project toward your interests in functional genomics or protein interaction networks.




Basic experience with Python and ML frameworks (e.g. PyTorch or TensorFlow) is a strong plus. Prior knowledge in bioinformatics is a plus, but not essential.




This opportunity is only given to students currently doing M.Sc. studies at the University of Copenhagen




Interested? Get in touch with Assoc. Prof. Marek Mutwil, PLEN, mutwil@plen.ku.dk

#Master #M.Sc #KU

Show more

Title: Full-stack Developer – customized code, AI and machine learning
Description:
Do you want a role as trusted advisor, where you will help our customers with a range of challenges focusing on delivering customized code tailored to each project? And are you passionate about working with AI and machine learning? Then you are the new colleague, we are looking for. This position is based at our office in Viby or in Nordhavn in Copenhagen with the flexibility to work from home.

Lead efficient and customized full-stack development solutions
You will be part of our Custom Software team, where we provide expert advice on software design and development. We help different customers in Denmark achieving digital transformation by analyzing business challenges and building custom software solutions to realize their visions.

As Full-stack Developer you will be responsible for designing and building complete software solutions ranging from setting up cloud infrastructure in Microsoft Azure; to developing robust, expressive, and well-tested backend code; as well as building accessible and flexible UIs. You will also have the opportunity to build AI-powered agents and applications.

Overall, your areas of responsibility will include:

Investigating customer needs to find the best fit software solution
Designing and architecting systems from front to back
Developing high-quality software that provides value to our customers
Monitoring and maintaining running software
Renovating legacy software to match new needs and challenges
Working with a range of technologies, languages, and frameworks to provide value across the whole stack
Working with AI to build powerful agents and tools to push our clients forward

Some of the skills we are interested in:

3+ years of experience in software development / full-stack development
A relevant bachelor’s or master’s degree within Computer Science or similar
Experience interacting with end customers
Experience with C# and .NET development
Experience working with web frontend frameworks and libraries such as Angular, React, HTMX and any others
Experience with cloud architecture and Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of or interest in project management
General good technical understanding and insight
Fluent in English – Danish is a plus but not a must

We understand that working with software involves an impossible number of technologies and frameworks to master, so don’t worry if you haven’t worked with every tool listed – we’d still love to hear from you!

Personal qualifications:

A skilled communicator: good at listening and building common understanding
A reasoned approach to decision making – you can consider the options available against the constraints of a task instead of just copy/pasting the same solution
Curiosity about how different parts of software fit together and how to build things from scratch
A knack for debugging and finding the causes of errors
Structured and diligent, you have the details covered
A team player, happy to work alongside your colleagues so we can build and improve together

What we can offer you:

Interesting and varied work: we have customers from many different industries that need software for different purposes
A hybrid workplace – a lot in the team work remotely for most of the week, but we group up when we want to run in person discussions or regularly on Fridays so we can keep regular contact with all our colleagues
Skilled and knowledgeable colleagues and the opportunity to learn and grow together
Opportunities for development: we want you to be the best you can be, and we attend conferences, run hackathons, maintain a solid library of professional literature and are always on the lookout for better ways that we can develop our skills
Social events, professional gatherings, and 1,700 amazing teamm8s as colleagues

Ready to be part of itm8?

We’re looking forward to receiving your CV.

If you have questions concerning the position, please feel free to contact Software Architect, Custom Software Adam Guest at phone +45 2493 9060 or e-mail adgue@itm8.com or TA Partner Trine Larsen at phone +45 2815 5806 or e-mail trlar@itm8.com.

All inquiries are treated confidentially. We hold ongoing interviews and complete the recruitment process when the right candidate is found. Furthermore, we obtain a criminal record prior to employment.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Remote Coding Expertise for AI Training - Swift
Description:
Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

You must know *Swift* for this specific AI training opportunity

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by…


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in your native language
Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with Swift
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $16 to $33 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.

Title: AI Enablement Lead
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Shape the Future of AI-Driven Autonomy with VML MAP Agentic Labs

Are you passionate about pushing the boundaries of AI technology?

If so, join our Agentic AI Lab, where you'll work at the cutting edge of multi-agent architectures, autonomous workflows, and AI reasoning systems.

VML MAP is seeking an AI Enablement Lead to drive the adoption and integration of AI-powered tools across our organization. This role is pivotal in ensuring that AI solutions are effectively implemented, enabling teams to optimize their workflows, enhance customer engagement, and drive operational efficiencies.

The ideal candidate is a tech-savvy problem solver with a strong background in AI technologies, process improvement, software implementation and stakeholder engagement.

We are looking for someone who is super interested and excited about becoming an expert in AI tooling across the board, taking full responsibility for enablement across the organization.

About VML MAP Agentic Labs

At VML MAP, we are investing in the future by leading the way in agentic AI development. Over the past year, we've built VML MAP Agentic Labs, a four-pronged initiative focused on designing, building, and implementing agentic AI solutions that drive real business value for ourselves and our clients. Our labs include:

Agentic Design Lab - A product centric function responsible for uncovering and designing value-driven agentic AI opportunities that are feasible, viable, and deliverable.

Agentic Development Lab - A best-in-class agentic platform and development practice, delivering multi-agent workflows with rapid, outcome-driven iterations and long-term adoption strategies.

Agentic Research Lab - Focused on agentic architecture, human+AI workflows and enabling fast, well-founded development decisions with deep methodology research.

Agentic Tooling Lab - Ensuring market-ready AI and agentic solutions are optimized for adoption and effectiveness instead of reinventing existing tools.

What will your day look like?

As part of the Agentic AI Lab, you'll be at the forefront of designing, developing, and optimizing intelligent multi-agent systems that tackle complex, real-world challenges.

Your Responsibilities Will Include

Identifying Opportunities & Process Change:


Analyze existing business processes to identify inefficiencies and areas where AI-driven automation can add value.
Conduct gap analysis to determine readiness for AI adoption and recommend necessary process modifications.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define success metrics and business objectives for AI implementation.
Advocate for a culture of continuous improvement by proactively identifying and recommending process enhancements before AI implementation.


AI Tooling Implementation & Enablement


Lead the deployment, configuration, and optimization of AI tools across VML MAP teams.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business needs and tailor AI solutions accordingly.
Ensure smooth integration of AI solutions within existing systems, providing technical guidance where necessary.
Monitor performance metrics and user adoption, adjusting strategies for continuous improvement.


Stakeholder Engagement & Training


Act as a bridge between technical teams, end-users, and leadership to facilitate AI adoption.
Conduct training sessions, workshops, and documentation to ensure seamless user onboarding.
Gather feedback from teams and iterate on AI tool usage to maximize efficiency and effectiveness.


Process Optimization & Best Practices


Identify opportunities for automation and AI-driven enhancements within business operations.
Develop best practices for AI tooling usage and provide ongoing support to ensure alignment with company objectives.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive AI literacy and strategic implementation.


Data & Compliance Management


Ensure AI solutions adhere to data privacy, security, and ethical guidelines.
Work with IT and compliance teams to mitigate risks associated with AI implementations.
Monitor AI-driven insights to validate accuracy and business impact.


What do you bring to the table?


Proven experience in Software, AI tooling implementation, automation, or related fields.
Strong understanding of AI, machine learning, and automation technologies.
Experience with AI-powered customer engagement platforms and business operations tools.
Ability to translate technical capabilities into business benefits.
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills.
Ability to develop training materials and deliver effective training programs.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Familiarity with data governance, security, and compliance frameworks.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in a marketing, customer experience, or digital transformation environment.
Familiarity with the martech ecosystem and AI-driven customer engagement solutions.
Background in process optimization and change management.
Previous experience in an enterprise AI implementation role.


A leader in personalized customer experiences

VML MAP is a world-leading Centre of Excellence that helps businesses humanize the relationship between the brand and the customer through hyper personalization at scale, marketing automation and CRM. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. Together, we are 1000 + technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 55+ nationalities.

A global network

We are part of the global VML network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

WPP (VML MAP) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML MAP on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn and X.

When you click "Apply now" below, your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data during when you apply for a role with us, on how you can update your information or have the information removed please read our Privacy policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice.

HTML:
Shape the Future of AI-Driven Autonomy with VML MAP Agentic Labs

Are you passionate about pushing the boundaries of AI technology?

If so, join our Agentic AI Lab, where you'll work at the cutting edge of multi-agent architectures, autonomous workflows, and AI reasoning systems.

VML MAP is seeking an AI Enablement Lead to drive the adoption and integration of AI-powered tools across our organization. This role is pivotal in ensuring that AI solutions are effectively implemented, enabling teams to optimize their workflows, enhance customer engagement, and drive operational efficiencies.

The ideal candidate is a tech-savvy problem solver with a strong background in AI technologies, process improvement, software implementation and stakeholder engagement.

We are looking for someone who is super interested and excited about becoming an expert in AI tooling across the board, taking full responsibility for enablement across the organization.

About VML MAP Agentic Labs

At VML MAP, we are investing in the future by leading the way in agentic AI development. Over the past year, we've built VML MAP Agentic Labs, a four-pronged initiative focused on designing, building, and implementing agentic AI solutions that drive real business value for ourselves and our clients. Our labs include:

Agentic Design Lab - A product centric function responsible for uncovering and designing value-driven agentic AI opportunities that are feasible, viable, and deliverable.

Agentic Development Lab - A best-in-class agentic platform and development practice, delivering multi-agent workflows with rapid, outcome-driven iterations and long-term adoption strategies.

Agentic Research Lab - Focused on agentic architecture, human+AI workflows and enabling fast, well-founded development decisions with deep methodology research.

Agentic Tooling Lab - Ensuring market-ready AI and agentic solutions are optimized for adoption and effectiveness instead of reinventing existing tools.

What will your day look like?

As part of the Agentic AI Lab, you'll be at the forefront of designing, developing, and optimizing intelligent multi-agent systems that tackle complex, real-world challenges.

Your Responsibilities Will Include

Identifying Opportunities & Process Change:

  • Analyze existing business processes to identify inefficiencies and areas where AI-driven automation can add value.
  • Conduct gap analysis to determine readiness for AI adoption and recommend necessary process modifications.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define success metrics and business objectives for AI implementation.
  • Advocate for a culture of continuous improvement by proactively identifying and recommending process enhancements before AI implementation.

AI Tooling Implementation & Enablement

  • Lead the deployment, configuration, and optimization of AI tools across VML MAP teams.
  • Work closely with stakeholders to understand business needs and tailor AI solutions accordingly.
  • Ensure smooth integration of AI solutions within existing systems, providing technical guidance where necessary.
  • Monitor performance metrics and user adoption, adjusting strategies for continuous improvement.

Stakeholder Engagement & Training

  • Act as a bridge between technical teams, end-users, and leadership to facilitate AI adoption.
  • Conduct training sessions, workshops, and documentation to ensure seamless user onboarding.
  • Gather feedback from teams and iterate on AI tool usage to maximize efficiency and effectiveness.

Process Optimization & Best Practices

  • Identify opportunities for automation and AI-driven enhancements within business operations.
  • Develop best practices for AI tooling usage and provide ongoing support to ensure alignment with company objectives.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive AI literacy and strategic implementation.

Data & Compliance Management

  • Ensure AI solutions adhere to data privacy, security, and ethical guidelines.
  • Work with IT and compliance teams to mitigate risks associated with AI implementations.
  • Monitor AI-driven insights to validate accuracy and business impact.

What do you bring to the table?

  • Proven experience in Software, AI tooling implementation, automation, or related fields.
  • Strong understanding of AI, machine learning, and automation technologies.
  • Experience with AI-powered customer engagement platforms and business operations tools.
  • Ability to translate technical capabilities into business benefits.
  • Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills.
  • Ability to develop training materials and deliver effective training programs.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
  • Familiarity with data governance, security, and compliance frameworks.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in a marketing, customer experience, or digital transformation environment.
  • Familiarity with the martech ecosystem and AI-driven customer engagement solutions.
  • Background in process optimization and change management.
  • Previous experience in an enterprise AI implementation role.

A leader in personalized customer experiences

VML MAP is a world-leading Centre of Excellence that helps businesses humanize the relationship between the brand and the customer through hyper personalization at scale, marketing automation and CRM. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. Together, we are 1000 + technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 55+ nationalities.

A global network

We are part of the global VML network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

WPP (VML MAP) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML MAP on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn and X.

When you click "Apply now" below, your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data during when you apply for a role with us, on how you can update your information or have the information removed please read our Privacy policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice.

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Do you picture yourself building the future of e-commerce at the LEGO Group?

We’re on the lookout for a passionate full-stack (with a backend twist) Software Engineer to join our Commercial Content Optimization team in Copenhagen. If you’re excited by the idea of improving how we manage and optimize product content at a global scale, then we want you to help us bring that vision to life!

We see a huge opportunity to bring together all the editorial magic – layouts, approvals, SEO, and content tools – to create content variations that truly engage. You’ll be at the heart of this, collaborating with engineers, designers, users, and collaborators to make it all happen. A “let’s try it and learn” attitude and the ability to break big dreams into bite-sized tasks will help you and your team crush it!

Our team is experienced but full of energy, and the product is still young and full of potential. You’ll have plenty of space to influence and contribute your ideas. 

No relocation assistance is offered for this position.


Core Responsibilities

As a Software Engineer on our team, you’ll take the lead on developing Commercial Content Optimization while also diving into the broader world of Digital Assets and Creation Management. We value flexibility, so expect to contribute to both backend and frontend work – and even other exciting development projects.





Shape, develop, and maintain our content platform, Content Studio.
Partner with designers to understand user needs and transform their creative visions into real-world software.
Team up with fellow engineers to make sure our frontend and backend play nicely together, and connect seamlessly with other systems through APIs and backend services.
Be a mentor – help others on the team improve their engineering practices and build a solid foundation.
Ensure the LEGO Group's e-commerce content works when it hits the market.
Build reusable components and share your magic across other product teams with similar goals.
And of course - write some truly awesome code!




Play your part in our team succeeding

In this role, you’ll be key to transforming how we create, manage, and optimize content for e-commerce. You’ll be part of a collaborative, autonomous, and agile team that takes full ownership of its products. We don’t just work together; we learn from each other. Plus, as the product and business evolve, there will be opportunities to jump into new teams and new challenges.

At the LEGO Group, we’re all about trust and ownership – we believe in empowering teams to own their work and bring their ideas to life!

Do you have what it takes?

To succeed in this role, you already have some of the following





Full-stack expertise, with a focus on backend.
Solid experience with TypeScript, Remix, and React (or similar frameworks), plus Postgres, MicroORM, and a pinch of SQL. If you’ve worked with AWS containers, S3, or SQS, even better!
Exposure to full-stack web development – you know the ins and outs of building robust web apps.
Collaboration skills – you work well with developers and designers alike.
A track record of building clean, maintainable code that lasts.
A curiosity to learn, grow, and share knowledge with the team.




Nice to have





Experience with technologies like micro-frontends, monorepos, headless CMS, and GitHub actions.
API design and specification experience.
Knowledge of accessibility standards, like WCAG AA.
A passion for exploring the latest web technologies, including ESNext/CSS features, faster build tooling, and innovative UI testing approaches.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more

Title: Software Engineer, Performance Insights
Description:
About The Role

We are seeking a highly skilled engineer to lead the design and development of systems that unlock deep system performance insights at scale. This role involves building innovative solutions-from conceptualization through production-that leverage statistical analysis and machine learning to diagnose performance issues, predict regressions, and optimize resource utilization across complex infrastructures. Your focus will be on developing broadly applicable, robust systems for real-world performance monitoring, analysis and optimization. Real world production system examples in this domain include FBDetect(Meta) , Servicelab(Meta) , FleetIO(Google) , and FP-Growth(Meta)

Key Responsibilities


System Architecture & Design:
Architect and build end-to-end performance monitoring systems that detect and analyze minute regressions and performance anomalies in production environments.
Design scalable solutions that collect, process, and analyze large volumes of performance data from diverse environments (e.g., bare metal, VMs, cloud infrastructures).
Develop modular systems that integrate statistical techniques and machine learning models to extract actionable insights and drive continuous performance improvements.
Statistical Analysis & Machine Learning:
Apply advanced statistical methods (e.g., change point detection, trend analysis) to identify subtle performance variations and anomalies in noisy datasets.
Integrate machine learning techniques, including reinforcement learning and predictive analytics, to optimize resource allocation and proactively detect performance degradations.
Collaborate with data science teams to refine models and validate findings against production data.
Software Development:
Write clean, efficient code in languages such as C/C++, Go, or Python, ensuring high performance and low overhead in critical production systems..
Collaboration & Communication:
Work cross-functionally with infrastructure, product, and operations teams to integrate performance insights into broader system optimization strategies.
Present data-driven insights and performance recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Mentor junior team members and contribute to best practices in performance engineering and analytics.
Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's or higher degree in one of Computer Science, Data Science, AI/ML, Statistics, Mathematics or a related technical field.
Strong grasp of statistical analysis and machine learning techniques and willingness to apply them to the system performance domain.
2+ years of experience in building production-grade Data/ML systems.
Proficiency in one or more programming languages (e.g., C/C++, Go, Python)


Preferred Qualifications


PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Data Science or related fields
5+ years of experience in AI/Data Science
Experience designing and deploying in-production systems for performance regression detection or optimization.
Background in implementing automated root cause analysis, anomaly detection, or predictive modeling using ML frameworks.
Understanding of containerization, orchestration platforms (Kubernetes, Docker), and cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP).
Strong analytical skills, excellent communication abilities, and a passion for solving complex performance problems in dynamic environments.


Strong candidates may also have experience with:


Knowledge of modern profiling tools (e.g., perf, eBPF) and techniques for low-level performance measurement and debugging.


What You'll Achieve


Create systems that empower teams to identify and address performance anomalies proactively, reducing downtime and resource waste.
Leverage data-driven insights to drive system optimizations that balance performance, scalability, and cost efficiency.
Contribute to a culture of continuous improvement, using innovative statistical and machine learning methods to shape the future of performance insights.


This role is ideal for an engineer who thrives in a fast-paced, data-driven environment and is eager to make a significant impact on the performance, reliability and efficiency of critical systems.

Title: Chuyên môn Lập trình để Huấn luyện AI (Tiếng Việt)
Description:
Outlier hỗ trợ các công ty đổi mới sáng tạo nhất thế giới cải thiện các mô hình trí tuệ nhân tạo (AI) của họ thông qua phản hồi từ con người. Bạn có phải là một kỹ sư phần mềm giàu kinh nghiệm và muốn đóng góp chuyên môn lập trình của mình để huấn luyện các mô hình AI không?

Chúng tôi hợp tác với các tổ chức để huấn luyện các mô hình ngôn ngữ AI lớn, giúp các mô hình AI thế hệ mới viết mã tốt hơn. Các dự án thường bao gồm các vấn đề riêng lẻ, rất đa dạng, liên quan đến việc tương tác với các mô hình này khi chúng học cách viết mã. Không yêu cầu kinh nghiệm trước đó về AI.

Về Cơ Hội Này


Outlier đang tìm kiếm các lập trình viên tài năng để giúp huấn luyện các mô hình trí tuệ nhân tạo thế hệ mới.
Đây là cơ hội làm việc tự do, từ xa với thời gian linh hoạt; bạn có thể làm việc bất cứ khi nào phù hợp với bạn.


Bạn có thể đóng góp chuyên môn của mình bằng cách…


Tạo và trả lời các câu hỏi liên quan đến khoa học máy tính để hỗ trợ việc huấn luyện các mô hình AI.
Đánh giá và xếp hạng mã nguồn được tạo ra bởi các mô hình AI.


Ví dụ về chuyên môn mong muốn:


Hiện đang theo học hoặc đã hoàn thành bằng cử nhân hoặc cao hơn trong lĩnh vực khoa học máy tính tại các tổ chức uy tín.
Thành thạo một hoặc nhiều ngôn ngữ lập trình sau: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, và Verilog.
Khả năng diễn đạt các khái niệm phức tạp một cách lưu loát bằng tiếng Việt.
Kỹ năng chú ý đến chi tiết xuất sắc, bao gồm ngữ pháp, dấu câu và hướng dẫn về phong cách viết.


Thanh Toán

Hiện tại, mức thanh toán cho các công việc dự án cốt lõi dành cho chuyên gia lập trình dao động từ 16 đến 33 USD mỗi giờ.


Mức thanh toán thay đổi dựa trên chuyên môn, đánh giá kỹ năng, địa điểm, nhu cầu dự án và các yếu tố khác. Ví dụ, mức thanh toán cao hơn có thể được áp dụng cho các ứng viên có bằng Tiến sĩ.
Đối với công việc không cốt lõi, chẳng hạn trong giai đoạn giới thiệu dự án ban đầu hoặc giai đoạn làm thêm ngoài giờ của dự án, mức thanh toán thấp hơn có thể được áp dụng. Một số dự án có các khoản thưởng khuyến khích. Vui lòng xem lại các điều khoản thanh toán cho từng dự án.


Lưu ý

Chúng tôi thu thập, lưu trữ và sử dụng dữ liệu cá nhân cho các mục đích kinh doanh chuyên nghiệp của mình, bao gồm thông báo cho bạn về các cơ hội có thể phù hợp và chia sẻ với các đối tác của chúng tôi. Chúng tôi giới hạn dữ liệu cá nhân thu thập trong phạm vi cần thiết và phù hợp để quản lý nhu cầu của ứng viên, cung cấp dịch vụ và tuân thủ các quy định pháp luật hiện hành. Mọi thông tin thu thập liên quan đến đơn ứng tuyển của bạn sẽ được xử lý theo Chính sách Bảo mật của Outlier và các chính sách nội bộ của chúng tôi để bảo vệ dữ liệu cá nhân.

Đây là cơ hội làm việc hợp đồng 1099 trên nền tảng Outlier.ai. Vì đây là cơ hội làm việc tự do, chúng tôi không cung cấp thực tập, bảo trợ, hoặc tuyển dụng chính thức. Bạn phải được ủy quyền làm việc tại quốc gia cư trú của mình. Nếu bạn là sinh viên quốc tế, bạn có thể đăng ký Outlier nếu bạn đang có visa. Hãy liên hệ cố vấn thuế và/hoặc nhập cư của bạn để được tư vấn cụ thể về tình huống của bạn.
Show more
HTML:
Outlier hỗ trợ các công ty đổi mới sáng tạo nhất thế giới cải thiện các mô hình trí tuệ nhân tạo (AI) của họ thông qua phản hồi từ con người. Bạn có phải là một kỹ sư phần mềm giàu kinh nghiệm và muốn đóng góp chuyên môn lập trình của mình để huấn luyện các mô hình AI không?

Chúng tôi hợp tác với các tổ chức để huấn luyện các mô hình ngôn ngữ AI lớn, giúp các mô hình AI thế hệ mới viết mã tốt hơn. Các dự án thường bao gồm các vấn đề riêng lẻ, rất đa dạng, liên quan đến việc tương tác với các mô hình này khi chúng học cách viết mã. Không yêu cầu kinh nghiệm trước đó về AI.

Về Cơ Hội Này

  • Outlier đang tìm kiếm các lập trình viên tài năng để giúp huấn luyện các mô hình trí tuệ nhân tạo thế hệ mới.
  • Đây là cơ hội làm việc tự do, từ xa với thời gian linh hoạt; bạn có thể làm việc bất cứ khi nào phù hợp với bạn.

Bạn có thể đóng góp chuyên môn của mình bằng cách…

  • Tạo và trả lời các câu hỏi liên quan đến khoa học máy tính để hỗ trợ việc huấn luyện các mô hình AI.
  • Đánh giá và xếp hạng mã nguồn được tạo ra bởi các mô hình AI.

Ví dụ về chuyên môn mong muốn:

  • Hiện đang theo học hoặc đã hoàn thành bằng cử nhân hoặc cao hơn trong lĩnh vực khoa học máy tính tại các tổ chức uy tín.
  • Thành thạo một hoặc nhiều ngôn ngữ lập trình sau: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, và Verilog.
  • Khả năng diễn đạt các khái niệm phức tạp một cách lưu loát bằng tiếng Việt.
  • Kỹ năng chú ý đến chi tiết xuất sắc, bao gồm ngữ pháp, dấu câu và hướng dẫn về phong cách viết.

Thanh Toán

Hiện tại, mức thanh toán cho các công việc dự án cốt lõi dành cho chuyên gia lập trình dao động từ 16 đến 33 USD mỗi giờ.

  • Mức thanh toán thay đổi dựa trên chuyên môn, đánh giá kỹ năng, địa điểm, nhu cầu dự án và các yếu tố khác. Ví dụ, mức thanh toán cao hơn có thể được áp dụng cho các ứng viên có bằng Tiến sĩ.
  • Đối với công việc không cốt lõi, chẳng hạn trong giai đoạn giới thiệu dự án ban đầu hoặc giai đoạn làm thêm ngoài giờ của dự án, mức thanh toán thấp hơn có thể được áp dụng. Một số dự án có các khoản thưởng khuyến khích. Vui lòng xem lại các điều khoản thanh toán cho từng dự án.

Lưu ý

Chúng tôi thu thập, lưu trữ và sử dụng dữ liệu cá nhân cho các mục đích kinh doanh chuyên nghiệp của mình, bao gồm thông báo cho bạn về các cơ hội có thể phù hợp và chia sẻ với các đối tác của chúng tôi. Chúng tôi giới hạn dữ liệu cá nhân thu thập trong phạm vi cần thiết và phù hợp để quản lý nhu cầu của ứng viên, cung cấp dịch vụ và tuân thủ các quy định pháp luật hiện hành. Mọi thông tin thu thập liên quan đến đơn ứng tuyển của bạn sẽ được xử lý theo Chính sách Bảo mật của Outlier và các chính sách nội bộ của chúng tôi để bảo vệ dữ liệu cá nhân.

Đây là cơ hội làm việc hợp đồng 1099 trên nền tảng Outlier.ai. Vì đây là cơ hội làm việc tự do, chúng tôi không cung cấp thực tập, bảo trợ, hoặc tuyển dụng chính thức. Bạn phải được ủy quyền làm việc tại quốc gia cư trú của mình. Nếu bạn là sinh viên quốc tế, bạn có thể đăng ký Outlier nếu bạn đang có visa. Hãy liên hệ cố vấn thuế và/hoặc nhập cư của bạn để được tư vấn cụ thể về tình huống của bạn.

Title: Application Engineer – design and programming in exciting automation
Place: Middelfart, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Application Engineer – design and programming in exciting automation

At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.

That's our story. Make it your story.

This position reports to

Service Operations Manager

Your role and responsibilities

Do you have a technical background and experience with software and PLC programming? Are you looking to work on exciting projects that create significant value and support the green transition? If you also enjoy variety in your workday and thrive in a collaborative environment with helpful, skilled colleagues – then this job may be tailor-made for you.

As an Application Engineer, you will be responsible for specifying, programming, documenting, testing, and commissioning solutions within traditional process automation. You'll be involved in all phases of the projects – from brainstorming and concept development to final installation and configuration.

Our projects focus on automation solutions for the Danish utility sector, and you will be part of our District Heating team.

You’ll primarily be based at our office in Middelfart, where flexibility is an integral part of daily life. However, during certain project phases – such as commissioning – you’ll work on-site with our customers, approximately 30 days per year.

Your responsibilities:


Develop, document, and test controller software
Understand the interface between IT, OT, and automation (PLC)
Conduct testing and debugging
Contribute to idea generation and concept development
Ensure timely project deliveries


Qualifications for the role


Degree in Marine Engineering or a similar technical field with relevant IT/OT competencies
Experience with several of the following methods and technologies:
- Advant Controller Programming: AC400, AC500, AC800
- Symphony Plus Melody Controller programming and understanding of DCS structures, OT, and fieldbus systems
- AC400 Tight, PLC-Connect, 800M Tight, Function Designer, Profibus, Modbus, AF100
- Documentation for IAT/FAT processes
- Knowledge of the FVI library


More about us

When you join ABB, you become part of a successful global company offering an excellent workplace environment, high job satisfaction, strong knowledge sharing, and a supportive team culture. We believe this is driven by our strong focus on employee development.

Whether you aspire to become a subject-matter expert or move into project management or leadership, we’ll support your journey through relevant training and education – including opportunities to visit our factories abroad. If you're looking to build an international career, ABB is your gateway to a world of opportunities.

Please apply via our international career page. Use ”Denmark” as search criteria, then you will get a list with all Danish job openings.

The deadline is May 19, 2025.

If you have any questions, you are very welcome to contact Engineering Manager, Stig K. Bøgelund at +45 27878 5852.

We look forward to receiving your application.

We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory
Show more

Title: Nhà Toán Ứng Dụng - Việt Nam
Description:
Nhà toán học ứng dụng (không thuộc Hoa Kỳ)

Outlier giúp các công ty sáng tạo nhất thế giới cải thiện mô hình AI của họ bằng cách cung cấp phản hồi của con người. Bạn có phải là một chuyên gia Toán học giàu kinh nghiệm muốn dùng chuyên môn của mình để đào tạo các mô hình AI?

Về Cơ Hội

Outlier đang tìm kiếm chuyên gia Toán học tài năng để giúp đào tạo các mô hình trí tuệ nhân tạo sáng tạo

Cơ hội làm việc tự do này là từ xa và giờ làm việc linh hoạt, vì vậy bạn có thể làm việc bất cứ khi nào phù hợp nhất với mình

Bạn có thể đóng góp chuyên môn của mình bằng cách…

Đánh giá tính thực tế và mức độ liên quan của văn bản theo từng miền cụ thể do các mô hình AI tạo ra

Soạn và trả lời các câu hỏi liên quan đến Toán học

Đánh giá và xếp hạng các phản hồi theo từng miền cụ thể do các mô hình AI tạo ra

Ví dụ về chuyên môn mong muốn:

Bằng cử nhân trở lên về Toán học hoặc một môn học liên quan

Kinh nghiệm làm việc như một chuyên gia Toán học

Có khả năng viết rõ ràng về các khái niệm liên quan đến Toán học bằng tiếng Anh lưu loát và tiếng việt

Sự Chi Trả

Hiện tại, mức lương cho công việc dự án cốt lõi dành cho các chuyên gia Toán học dao động từ $19,50 đến $32,50 USD

Tỷ lệ khác nhau dựa trên chuyên môn, đánh giá kỹ năng, vị trí, nhu cầu dự án và các yếu tố khác. Ví dụ, mức giá cao hơn có thể được đưa ra cho tiến sĩ. Đối với công việc không cốt lõi, chẳng hạn như trong giai đoạn triển khai dự án ban đầu hoặc giai đoạn làm thêm giờ của dự án, mức giá thấp hơn có thể được áp dụng. Một số dự án cung cấp các khoản thanh toán khuyến khích. Vui lòng xem lại các điều khoản thanh toán cho từng dự án.

XIN LƯU Ý: Chúng tôi thu thập, lưu giữ và sử dụng dữ liệu cá nhân cho mục đích kinh doanh chuyên nghiệp của mình, bao gồm thông báo cho bạn về các cơ hội có thể bạn quan tâm và chia sẻ với các chi nhánh của chúng tôi. Chúng tôi giới hạn dữ liệu cá nhân mà chúng tôi thu thập ở mức mà chúng tôi tin là phù hợp và cần thiết để quản lý nhu cầu của người đăng ký, cung cấp dịch vụ của chúng tôi và tuân thủ luật hiện hành. Mọi thông tin chúng tôi thu thập liên quan đến đơn đăng ký của bạn sẽ được xử lý theo Chính sách quyền riêng tư ngoại lệ cũng như các chính sách và chương trình nội bộ của chúng tôi được thiết kế để bảo vệ dữ liệu cá nhân.

Đây là cơ hội hợp đồng 1099 trên nền tảng Outlier.ai. Vì đây là cơ hội làm việc tự do nên chúng tôi không cung cấp cơ hội thực tập, tài trợ hoặc việc làm. Bạn phải được phép làm việc tại quốc gia cư trú của bạn. Nếu bạn là sinh viên quốc tế, bạn có thể đăng ký Outlier nếu bạn có thị thực. Bạn nên liên hệ với cố vấn thuế và/hoặc nhập cư nếu có câu hỏi cụ thể liên quan đến hoàn cảnh của bạn.
Show more

Title: Full Stack Developer - Student Assistant
Description:
The Role




As a student worker in Inpay's Community Payments team, you'll get a chance to learn from the best in full stack development, gain hands-on development experience, and co-create an exciting new product for international customers. Our team consists of skilled developers who specialize in creating integrations between Inpay and external financial service providers. Our goal is to develop scalable and highly automated solutions to support Inpay's continuous expansion, making our team's work crucial for the success of our business.




We're seeking a new colleague who shares our passion for delivering quality work, learning, and continuous improvement. Our team works in an agile environment, with frequent interactions between our development teams and internal stakeholders. You'll have the opportunity to work alongside a diverse group of colleagues with expertise in various areas, creating an excellent environment for growth and learning.




Our Head Office is located in the heart of Copenhagen. We believe in having fun at work and offer exciting events like office parties, Friday bars, yoga, dance, and other activities both in and out of the office.




You will partake in a thorough onboarding program and have four senior team members to learn from and lean on. We believe that bringing young talent to our team and company is a huge benefit, and for the right person with the willingness to learn, there is every opportunity to grow with us!







Your primary tasks when onboarded and ready to do so will be:

Work closely with your senior team members to gain domain knowledge and gradually enable yourself to work independently on backlog items.
Help your team develop new integrations with external providers.
Work with stakeholders, developers, and the Team Lead to understand business requirements and transform them into functional software.




Your profile:

The most important thing for us is that you want to learn and have a go-getter mentality in terms of delivering good solutions for our customers.
You are a student of computer science or a similar relevant course, preferably pursuing your Master’s degree (it's a must)




We will teach you the domain of working in payments, and although it is an advantage if you have experience working in Ruby, it is not a requirement.




You are characterized by:

A talent for coding! You love working with development and want to learn.
A strong team spirit and sense of co-ownership of the team's work.
Becoming energized by getting tasks done!




It is a big advantage if you have experience with:

NodeJS, JavaScript.
Ruby on Rails.
SQL Databases.
Selenium WebDriver.




The position is for 15-20 working hours a week – we are flexible with which days may fit your schedule best.




We offer:

A great place for a student worker to lay down roots for a professional career in fintech in a supportive and exciting environment with lots of learning options. From flexible working hours to social events, professional development, and health insurance, we strive to offer one of the best working environments around.

Ready to join?

Inpay is a cross-border payments company, connecting businesses and communities to a global banking network that helps them thrive. Since 2008, we've helped financial institutions, iGaming operators, corporates, NGOs, and others move money to the right places quickly, easily, and securely.

Our smart technology, innovative products, robust compliance, and in-house experts from 45+ countries solve complex payment challenges with an industry-leading 99% transaction success rate. Regulated by the Danish Financial Supervisory Authority, we’ve been recognized as Denmark’s fastest-growing company and Europe’s fastest-growing fintech.




Our headquarters are in the royal quarter of central Copenhagen, with further offices in London. You can see a snapshot of what working life looks like here.




Find out more about Inpay here.

Show more

  • Work closely with your senior team members to gain domain knowledge and gradually enable yourself to work independently on backlog items.
  • Help your team develop new integrations with external providers.
  • Work with stakeholders, developers, and the Team Lead to understand business requirements and transform them into functional software.


Your profile:

  • The most important thing for us is that you want to learn and have a go-getter mentality in terms of delivering good solutions for our customers.
  • You are a student of computer science or a similar relevant course, preferably pursuing your Master’s degree (it's a must)


We will teach you the domain of working in payments, and although it is an advantage if you have experience working in Ruby, it is not a requirement.


You are characterized by:

  • A talent for coding! You love working with development and want to learn.
  • A strong team spirit and sense of co-ownership of the team's work.
  • Becoming energized by getting tasks done!


It is a big advantage if you have experience with:

  • NodeJS, JavaScript.
  • Ruby on Rails.
  • SQL Databases.
  • Selenium WebDriver.


The position is for 15-20 working hours a week – we are flexible with which days may fit your schedule best.


We offer:

A great place for a student worker to lay down roots for a professional career in fintech in a supportive and exciting environment with lots of learning options. From flexible working hours to social events, professional development, and health insurance, we strive to offer one of the best working environments around.

Ready to join?

Inpay is a cross-border payments company, connecting businesses and communities to a global banking network that helps them thrive. Since 2008, we've helped financial institutions, iGaming operators, corporates, NGOs, and others move money to the right places quickly, easily, and securely.

Our smart technology, innovative products, robust compliance, and in-house experts from 45+ countries solve complex payment challenges with an industry-leading 99% transaction success rate. Regulated by the Danish Financial Supervisory Authority, we’ve been recognized as Denmark’s fastest-growing company and Europe’s fastest-growing fintech.


Our headquarters are in the royal quarter of central Copenhagen, with further offices in London. You can see a snapshot of what working life looks like here.


Find out more about Inpay here.

Title: Front End Web Developer
Description:
hackajob is collaborating with Amplience to connect them with exceptional tech professionals for this role.

Front End Developer

About Amplience

We’re here to rid the world of bad shopping experiences.

It’s a bold aim, and one that needs both a dynamic team and a very different way of working.

That’s why we want people who can weave their unique skills, experience and character into a global team that learns, shares, grows and succeeds together.

Our people are all stewards of the business, helping us to win through care, commitment and conviction - and in return we open up a whole new world of flexibility around where, when and how you work.

It’s an exciting time to be part of Amplience. We have new leadership, new goals and new opportunities. So let’s find out where you fit in…

And if you’re still wondering what we actually do… Amplience is the AI Content company that brings together data, performance insights and generative AI. We help 400+ of the world’s biggest brands, from Liberty and Mulberry, to Argos and Crate & Barrel, deliver persuasive content for every shopping context, fueling truly personalised and connected experiences.

Location: Middlesbrough / Manchester / London / Remote / Hybrid

Employment Type: Full Time

Expected Salary: £50k

Role Availability: Immediate

Typical Hiring Process


HR culture, fit, ability to work interview (~30m Remote)
Departmental interview (~45m remote)
Optional cross team validation interview (~45m remote)


What to expect

We are looking for a Front-End Web Developer who has an eye for exciting, engaging web design that consistently elevates the marketing of our brand and website.

The successful candidate is a creative and detail-oriented, systemic thinker, who enjoys defining and building web design patterns, elements, and resources. It is a highly collaborative role that works with product marketing and solutions teams.

This role presents an exciting opportunity to help evolve a world-class website that is at the heart of our go-to-market strategy.

You will be focused on building, maintaining and providing best practice for Front End Website applications in Amplience.

You will use a mix of technologies including web technologies (JavaScript/ReactJS/NextJS), backend technologies (NodeJS) as well as specific technologies required to support deployments and integrations with 3rd party platforms such as Analytics.

You should have a good technical understanding to be able to accurately size work OR highlight the investigation required to do so (ie, spikes)

What You’ll Do / Key Responsibilities

Contribute towards the company’s successes by developing and designing components for our website. The successful candidate will work on improving existing projects and processes with the opportunity for new projects.

The candidate will have a keen eye for design and understands the importance of design systems in everything they create. They can demonstrate the ability to collaborate with a creative team and add technical know-how to ideas that are explored.

You are an excellent communicator who thrives either working as part of a team or on self-motivated projects. Your day-to-day focus will be varied - building web components and page designs that are created in Figma, website feature development, bug fixing and optimising website performance.

Whatever the task, you are the type of person that enjoys jumping in, learning more, and solving problems. We are, at our foundation, a modern technology company, so the successful candidate will share our passion for all things tech, with an appetite for presenting complex concepts in a simple and cohesive manner for our customers.

Primary Focus


Developing and maintain the Amplience corporate website ( www.amplience.com )
Assist with usage documentation
Working closely other stakeholders in your team (Developers, QA and VP Product Solutions)


Secondary Focus


Assist teams with other Front-End web applications which may include demos or documentation sites etc
Close communication with product and engineering for opportunities to improve sites with updated product capabilities


Primary Skills

What we are looking for


Solid working experience as a Front-End Web Developer (3+ years of website development)
Understanding of MACH architecture (Microservices, API First, Cloud, Headless)
Experience working with Headless technologies especially CMS
Great modern Front-End web experience (React, NextJS, Typescript, Vue etc)
Knowledge of Atomic Design methodology, and how this applies to everything they create
Good understanding and implementation of performance improvements (Site speed etc)
Good understanding of SEO and compliance best practices
Experience of building multi-locale websites
A good understanding of Figma, and its relation to the web development process
Basic Front-End experience (HTML / CSS / JS / Handlebars)
Previous experience working with any of the following: REST APIs, GraphQL, Webhooks, Handlebars, JSON and/or a CMS platform is a plus
Strong source control, version control knowledge (ie. git, releases)
Good collaboration with cross discipline team
Scripting experience (NodeJS, Bash etc)
Ability to develop with testing in mind (ie. unit tests / end-to-end tests)
Ability to contribute to design sessions using whiteboarding tooling such as Miro
Cross team collaboration for the broader business to help, review & learn from
Risk assessment - ensuring that solutions have no or limited downtime and non-breaking changes


Secondary Skills


Cross team collaboration for the broader business to help, review & learn from
Some knowledge of hosting technology
Ability to document solutions so that others can pick up and understand how to run / use
Share responsibility across full lifecycle of a feature including contributing to QA / UAT


About You


Genuine excitement of working in the content / commerce ecosystem
Good collaboration skills (ie paired programming and working with QA)
Ability to contribute to find the best solutions
Desire to work with new and old technologies and continuous learning
Ability to accurately size projects
Good coding practices
Good organisation skills
Good co-ordination skills
Ability to context switch depending on business priorities / urgency
Good problem solving skills
Ability to be creative with solutions
Show more
